name: Lauren Behel
text: I had a great experience! I’m submitting my review a couple weeks late (sorry). But— I had gotten my phone screen “fixed” at a rival store (the one in the mall), and they failed to install my screen correctly.... twice. And left my battery loose in the phone so that it was not glued down as it originally was to the inside. They also failed to glue in and screw in my new screen properly. I walked into this other store with a lose screw clanging around in the phone. So. I came here, to the Cell Phone Doctor to have it PROPERLY fixed, based on reviews I had seen. I made a great choice. He immediately told me what they had done wrong, fixed the battery issue with no extra charge, and was nothing but kind and fast at his work. A real expert. I had no issues, he was very respectful and easy to deal with, and a few weeks out I’ve had no issues! So I suppose it’s good that I’m late to reviewing, as I can see that it is still holding up perfectly! Thank you!!!

name: Catherine Kloess
text: I love Cellairis and have used them twice previously. The cool part is that they protect the screen so that it doesn't break again with a cover that is not likely to break. This location is the exception. I just wanted to buy the screen over the phone and have it shipped so that I could travel only once to the store. This store is a bit of a journey for me.  They would not under any circumstance take a credit card over the phone and do this for the customer that is in Cellairis' customer data base. I am so visible on the internet. It makes me wonder if perhaps they had an employee who took customer information and used it for something nefarious. The idea that they could not take payment over the phone is odd in this day and age. I simply found them to be adversarial and not interested in one more customer. Every other Cellairis I have ever been to was completely amazing. If this is the worse thing that happens to me I will be just fine. I would not recommend this location to anyone and would advise you to consider what type of people own and operate a location that would behave this way.

resp.text:
Sorry for the experience Catherine,
However I would like to announce this to you that the ownership and management for this location has changed and we do accept online payments now.

name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

text:
Tuesday, May 24 I took my shattered iPhone 6 to one of your locations in Bel Air Mall to be serviced. Specifically, I was at the kiosk located across from Victoria's Secret, and Ryan was working. He did an excellent job replacing my phone screen as well as talking with me throughout the process while we established mutual connections and potential endeavors. Even when I discovered a small issue after I left the mall, Ryan made every effort to rectify the problem. The issue with the phone was pre-existing, but he treated it as if it had happened in-store as he diligently worked to get my phone back to normal in the quickest possible time. Ryan made an inauspicious event turn into a pleasurable experience.

If you have any malfunctions with your phone or need a new case, Cellairis should be the first place you go.

name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

text: I went down to acemobile wednesday  I had a broken charging port on my cellphone was not holding a charge I keep losing a charge I had replace my battery and I had to replace my power button on my cellphone I went to quick fix to replace my power button they fixed it then I went down to acemobile wednesday I had connector issue with my cellphone he fixed the problem with in 45 minutes my phone was holding charge without any problems I have a ZTE Max pro cellphone  these type of phones give you problems over time  battery problems power button problems and also connector problems but acemobile did a good job with fixing my charger port they are really good and they have good prices to help you fixed your cellphone good job acemobile 😤🙏

name: Aylin Turkoglu
text: New manager doing better job then old one. Was friendly and got my device fixed fast!!! Old manager let it sit for two months without fixing it and new one didn’t let it sit for even two hours! Very happy, will be coming back.

name: Usagi Tsukino
text: Thank goodness they're under new management! New manager is clean and most importantly kind and tends to individual device needs. I expect great things and will be coming back thanks to the promising new management.

name: Montanna Minnifield
text: It has almost been two months since I’ve dropped my Apple Watch off for the screen to be replaced. I was told it would be 2 weeks at most for repair. Every time I call it sends me straight to voicemail, I’ve left multiple messages with no response, and when I do go to the store they are always closed. I most definitely do not recommend. I just want me Apple Watch and the money I paid for it as well.

resp.text:
Montanna,  We have now Reopened after battling covid-19 which cause a abrupt and long  temp closure

We have reached out to let you know your watch is ready for pickup and we will get you taken care of of

Hope you have a fantastic day and see you soon !

name: Judy Jacobson
text: I brought my sons tablet in to repair a broken screen, that was on January 17th of this year. I have called several times and left messages, with no reply. At first they said 3-5 days, then 2 more, then another week etc...etc....the one time my husband called and actually talked to someone it was a rather rude female that told him to not call again. An employee of Walmart stated she hasn’t seen anyone at the store for over a week. I wish someone could be honest and tell me what is going on. My son uses his tablet for communication. I really would like my tablet and the $200 I have paid back. I don’t know who to talk to. Customer service is not returning calls. SO frustrated!

resp.text: Hey Mrs Jacobson  we will be in-touch  today and find out what’s going on with this repair!

name: Oscar Castro
text: I had them order me a screen to repair my phone, well they got the screen in , but then they closed due to covid, and i totally understand, but i was not aware of the situation so i took my phone else where, a week later they finally opened, but i already had my screen repaired, so i politely asked for a refund, and was told i should recieve my refund in 5 to 10 business, its been 2 months now , no refund and no one will answer the phone, ive left voice messages and a number where they can reach me, but its been total silence on there end. I dont understand. Thats why im giving them 1 star, when issue is fixed ill gladly change my rating but 1star for now.

resp.text:
Hello Oscar, Thank you for bringing this situation to our notice. This is not by any means reflective of the #iFixandRepair standards of service and customer satisfaction.
Please email us at info@ifixandrepair.com with your contact info and details about your case. We will do our best to fix this for you.

name: Amber Blackshear
text:
Unfortunately I can't leave a 0 star review.
I will not do business here again. Unprofessional and rude. The store is rarely ever even open! Paid over $200 for a botched phone repair and I can't even get it back up there to make them fix it. Do not recommend.

resp.text:
Hello amber we apologize we have been out completely due to Positive covid test and the symptoms that follow.

We would love to resolve the issue with your repair as you have a lifetime defect warranty and are covered by most anything other then physical damage or liquid exposure !

Please call the store at 334521112 as we have called a few times but there is no voicemail setup

We Hope to get this issue fixed for you !

name: Joshua Remley
text: I paid $300 to get my note 9 screen replaced. Its been almost a month when I was told it would be 2-3 days. I have yet to get my phone fixed and its almost impossible to get someone on the phone. This has been the worst experience when trying to fix any phone. Not to mention I was told the reason its taking so long  is because the wrong screen was shipped to them the past 3 times they sent the replacement screen!!!

name: Tesla Jay Waterloo
text: Quality of repairs is varying. Some are great and others are rushed through and poorly done. Service also varies too. I'd go for a battery or front screen replacement and not much else unless you just absolutely need it done.

name: Dave Myers
text: They cannot change samsung watch battery or sell me one and there attitude was rude to tell me they can't and don't have license to do so will never be back

resp.text:
Hi Dave, Thank you for bringing this situation to our notice. This is not by any means reflective of the #iFixandRepair standards of service and customer satisfaction.
Please email us at info@ifixandrepair.com with your contact info and details about your case. We will do our best to fix this for you.

name: Karen Bostick
text: Apple could not have given me better service in their own store, than Duncan did. He was super busy, with other customers in the small store, and simultaneously gave us all extremely courteous and excellent service. I can honestly say that I have never had better or friendlier service in my entire life, and I am 55. Thank you so much, and God bless!

resp.text:
Hello Karen, thank you so much for taking the time to leave this great review!

Here at iFixandRepair, our dedicated staff works very diligently to make sure you love our work. This provides us with great encouragement to keep doing what we do!

name: Andrea Miller
text: Duncan stayed late just to help replace the screen and battery in our time of need! Very helpful, knowledgeable, and professional! Definitely recommend this place!

resp.text:
Andrea,  thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us! we're pleased to read that our staff made you smile!! We strive to provide fast and friendly service.

Have a fantastic day!

Mark, thank you for this friendly review. We hope to see you again soon! Please bring your friends and family!

Best regards!

name: Pam Hutcheson
text: I really needed a screen fixed on an iPad that was my Autistic son's. Preferably same day. Brandon was able to fix it in about 3 hours. I would highly recommend iFixandRepair at Walmart in Dothan.

resp.text: We are so happy we were able to get you taken care of

name: Taylor Kathlynn
text: 10/10 recommend! Dunkin super helpful and super sweet to both me and my rowdy three year old.  He educated me on what was going on with my phone and then fix the problem in 10 minutes. They’re super affordable as well! Go see these awesome guys!

name: Brianna Kilow
text: I cracked and destroyed my Apple Watch and called over to this business asking for pricing. I spoke with a guy name Duncan(maybe not his name, not sure) and he gave me a price and told me it would take 5 DAYS for it to be fixed and returned back to me. I dropped my watch off on April 16th almost at closing time. It is April 30th and I still have not received my watch. I’ve called multiple times to check the status and every time they tell me it will be back in a couple of days. I called Monday and I was told he received tracking and that it’ll be here in a couple of days. I sent a friend to the place of business to get a status update and my friend was told that it shipped today ( April 30th) and will be here in a few days. So I called back up there and talked to the same guy and he told me that they received tracking information Monday but it didn’t ship until today (BS). I also made him aware that my last day in the area would be Sunday and I will need my watch before I leave, he says if it’s not here by Sunday we can ship it to you ( which I’m sure will be another week). At this point I asked to speak to the manager, he said he wasn’t in but he would call him to see if they could expedite my watch ( how do you expedite a shipment that has already been shipped) and he would get back in touch with. Oh he also mentioned that the reason why it’s taking so long is because the person they sent the watches to is backed up with orders and his shop has been closed and I said why wasn’t I told this from the beginning, I was told 5 days and he said he didn’t know that information until after my watch shipped. So yea, no watch still and it still isn’t promised to be here before I leave town. Worse experience EVER. OH NOT TO MENTION THIS IS COSTING ME $258.

resp.text: Brianna please accept our apologies on the delays in meeting those original time frames   We have seen a fast increase is Apple Watch Repair’s and working with our partners to insure delays are cut down to a minimum going forward we strive to get every device in and out in the fastest possible time . Communication is key and along with the partners we use are working on a ticketing system that will offer status update along the way we greatly appreciate your business and if there is anything you ever need please don’t hesitate to call or stop in! Stay safe and well

name: Blake Bedsole
text: Took my mother to get a new phone today as she busted her old one (motherboard and all) not really fixable; however, after getting a new phone (through a phone company) and being told the phone she picked has no screen protectors available, I quickly messaged ifixandrepair Walmart location, in hopes they would have something. Within two minutes I received a response with the product I requested and the price. Met with Tyler as I came into the store explaining we were on the search for screen protectors for which he showed us all available options and what they would look like once installed. Needless to say not only did my mom get one but so did I and we are both very pleased. I recommend anyone with phone repairs or just on the look for new accessories or gadgets visit Tyler and his team for prompt and quality service!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Blake. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us — and we agree, Tyler is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

Please follow us on Facebook @ifardothan.

Have a lovely day!

name: Kayden Chapel
text:
I was out of town and my phone crashed on me. I went in to get it fixed and they said it would be a week and they would ship it to me. After 35 days and tons of phone calls to the owner my phone could not be located and all of them were caught in multiple lies. If that wasn’t bad enough they stopped answering my calls so I was left without a phone. After a month and a half I finally got my phone back and there were even more problems than when I gave it to them. NEVER TAKE YOUR PHONE HERE. The owner Tyler lied to my face and wouldn’t even give me my phone back when I asked for it 6 hours after I left it. I have never dealt with so many dishonest people at one store. Worst experience of my life. The experience was horrible, and to make it worse I got took for $200 and they refused to refund after not fixing the problems and causing more.

Response 2: I guess the “board repair time frame” covers all the lies told. Also once again another lie. Ifixit denied the charges being refunded and the credit card company had to eat them.

resp.text:
Unfortunately. The board repair time frame was out of our control . As a third party board repair team is the ones we use . While having it at board repair a charge back was placed on the payment and was sent back to you as soon as we had it back in our position . This was also handled at the end of last year as we have the charge back notice  as it was never our desire for the time frame we updated you based on the information provided by the boated repair team

Some iPhone 7 devices have many many  board level and chip level flaws that are design issues and also beyond anything that can be controlled or prevented

name: Mary T
text:
DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!

Took in my Galaxy S7 Edge after I dropped it and screen turned green and flickered. Everything else was working great, including charging.

Was told it needed new screen. Paid $230 with my debit card and was then informed that there would be no warranty. Got an email receipt.

Got my phone back a few days later and it was down to 1%. So I immediately tried to charge it and got an error message that the battery temp was too low to charge.

Went in the next morning and was told it needed a new battery because old battery would not charge new LED screen (which I should have been told on first visit). Paid $60 MORE. Also told there was no tax since I paid with cash and was not offered a receipt nor one by email (like previous time).

My husband picks the phone up, tries to charge it and gets the SAME error message.

He calls them and is now told that the motherboard is probably bad and it needs a new one. NO FLIPPING WAY was I giving them another dime!!

I am out almost $300 and STILL have no phone to use!!!

They basically  just took my money and did not fix my phone.

I DO NOT recommend this place AT ALL and will be contacting BBB!

resp.text: Mam, I'm sorry that the repair did not work out to your satisfaction. We did everything in our power to help you with your phone. And provided you with every option at our disposal. And we did everything that we could over the phone to explain to you the error that your phone was still having from both me and my assistant. Unfortunately sometimes when performing a repair, be it on a car a house or an electronic device there is more wrong with it than just the issue that you drop it off for. These issues are unfortunate, nonetheless, but sometimes they are there. I apologize you're unsatisfied, and if you change your mind and decide to get the device fixed as we said on the phone, the amount that you have already paid for the battery repair will apply towards the motherboard. I hope you have a great day and if you need anything else give us a call!!

name: Kim McConnon
text: Best place around! Easy to get affordable phone repairs! Much appreciated! They are knowledgeable and make it stress free

name: Blair McAbee
text:
Although my phone was repaired, I will not recomend them. I do not trust businesses that ask for payment up front and then tell you they have a no refund policy if their service comes into question. Just because you call something a store policy, does not make it legally or morally correct.
I award this business a negative one star rating.

resp.text: Glad that your phone works! I cannot find a ticket for repair with your info on it ... Nonetheless, the business policies that we've developed over the years are a direct reflection on experiences we've had in the past. And I assure you in this industry they are very commonplace. The parts that we use do carry a warranty. Again glad to hear that your phone's doing well, you need anything please let us know!

When I picked it up the next day I asked if it had been refunded. The woman told me I was ridiculous and just handed me a $20 bill Extremely unprofessional.

resp.text:
Hi Brandon!!!
We did order your part for overnight delivery, unfortunately due to an error in FedEx system we did not receive it overnight. I do remember the conversation with you and did agree that it would be no issue to refund you the overnight shipping. We received the part and had it in your hands today as well as the refund. and after watching the tape I couldn't find a single instance where my employee called you ridiculous. But nonetheless, I apologize that you had an unpleasant experience and we look forward to helping you next time should the need arise. Have a great day!!

Total scam. First you pay 40 dollars to get the phone evaluated which was not explained from the start, then another hundred for a potential repair not a guaranteed repair mind you! I should have just got a replacement from my phone company for a hundred. I was trying to get my contacts. What a waste of forty dollars time  and potentially wasting a total of
140 dollars with no guarantee! He must pay for reviews as he is not credible or honest! Unbelievable, he is still in business! Don’t trust anything he says or states! Go elsewhere,  anywhere but there! Trust me there are far more reputable honest folks that charge the right amount to start and either can or can not do the repair.

I am reporting him to better business bureau for his deception and dishonesty.

resp.text:
Miss Lee we wish you the best as we did on the phone the other day. We charge 40 $ to diagnose any device that comes in unresponsive, to cover our costs  and then apply that money towards the total cost of the repair if the customer chooses to do so. We explain that without fail every time we do a diagnostic. I apologize for any misunderstanding that you had with us in our initial conversation.

We take the word guarantee very seriously, and would never guarantee repair on a phone we haven't seen in months. That Miss Lee and that alone is why would not guarantee a repair. We do guarantee our repairs and most of all parts have a lifetime warranty. I'm sorry that you felt that this review was necessary as well as  the conversation and language you used with us on the phone the other day was necessary but we do sincerely wish you the best.

JF

name: Karen Mizzell
text:
On a Sunday afternoon we had 3 phones to update...one which had been lost. What should have been a simple process  turned into a long drawn out deal bc one of the phones had never been backed up or updated in years so there was a lot of manual work that had to be done.

Bre who was the only associate in the store was extremely friendly and very professional. After about 20 minutes of us working, there were numerous customers that came in and she took care of everyone so efficiently and professionally!  We were there almost 3 hours and Bre never stopped, complained or panicked but was calm and efficient.

I would recommend her and this store to anyone! Thanks for such a refreshingly wonderful experience!

name: Michelle Maher (Michelle Maher-Williams)
text:
I accidentally left a review yesterday for this location under another name, so Bre is probably wondering who in the world that person is because she doesn’t remember helping them 😂 So in the spirit of continuity, this review is for my niece, Maddie.
My Dad took my niece to AT&T in Chelsea earlier today to get a SIM card for her phone and to add her to his plan.  I messaged him to have Bre help them, since she did such a good job getting me the phone that I wanted (the iPhone 11) and saving me a good bit of money on my monthly bill. I needn’t have worried, because Bre was on the ball and already helping them. In fact, she had just gotten my niece a great deal on a new phone and airbuds.  My niece really liked my new phone, the iPhone 11, and she’s been wanting airbuds ever since they came out, so she is beyond thrilled with the sale. I recommend this location 100% and my sister is heading there tomorrow!

text: My husband and I went to the AT&T store in Chelsea to upgrade our phones. What is usually a long and miserable experience was made very pleasurable by Gage who was very knowledgeable, personable, and patient downloading thousands of pictures from my old phone and setting us up on our new ones. Thanks so much Gage! Well done!

name: Carol Shelton
text: In and out quickly

name: Amelia Landers
text: My husband, mother-in-law, and I had a horrible experience for the first time at this AT&T location. We went in to upgrade a couple of phones and the sales lady that was in there (unfortunately we did not get her name) was extremely rude. When we first went in there, my husband was trying to explain to her what we were there for and the whole time he’s talking to her, she’s on a personal FaceTime call. And might I add, she asked my husband for his phone number and PIN number to our account while on the phone with that person which I’m quite sure goes against their privacy policy. But to make matters worse, she had a very bad attitude and snarky remarks with my husband and mother-in-law while talking trade-in value of phones. Needless to say we left and did not do business there today and we will no longer do business as long as she works there.

resp.text: Hi Amelia! We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates. We will work with our employees to ensure you are provided with the customer service you deserve. We’d like to learn more about your recent experience – could you please email us at customerservice@primecomms.com?

To make a long story short Blue was already on it when I walked into the store this morning. He very knowledgeable in what he does and today I seen his passion for making things work out for his customers.

resp.text: Hi Terrell! Thank you for bringing this to my attention and I’m sorry to hear you received conflicting information. We’d be happy to resolve this issue for you, please email us at prioritycustomer@primecomms.com with the name and phone number on the account, the store's address, date of your visit and a brief summary of your experience. We hope to hear from you soon!

text: Great place and environment...was in and out in under and hour... grateful for them

name: Sarah McNeely
text: I have used Cell Phone Rehab to help me fix my son’s iPhone and my daughter’s iPad and the owner is professional and knowledgeable and helpful and the technicians are very well trained and did an awesome job both times! I definitely will continue to use them for any future repair needs my family and I have!!

name: TIERRA REID
text: My experience with this business was great. Mrs Russell and her team made my phone look brand new!! They are open 7 days a week too.

name: Jay J
text:
They replaced the glass on my sg note8 camera on the back. Quick and professional.
I would recommend.

name: Christian Clark
text: Great service I love the hospitality I will definitely recommend this place 🖤🖤🖤

name: Ana Jones
text: Professional staff, the service was quick and it has good prices with great variety of accessories!

name: Edward Ramski
text: My wife dropped her Samsung S8+ phone and spider webbed her screen.  I had used CPR before but before the new owner bought the business about 3 years ago.  My first call was answered by the owner who quoted a (to me) reasonable price and ordered the screen (which wasn't in stock) without me having to come to the store.  I dropped the phone off the next day and the person I dealt with was very knowledgeable, answering all my questions. I was called late that afternoon but chose to wait until the next day to pick it up.  It was like a brand new phone. Wife is happy, I am happy.  Great service, friendly competent employees, and a willingness to go the little bit extra that makes for great customer service.

name: Andrea S.
text: Really needed help with my cell phone. Locked myself out of my phone when I changed the PIN. Dummy.  Anyway, I called and ended up talking to the Kristie, the owner.  Called back trying to get a tech guy at the office.  My call was rolled back over to Kristie. She was going to call them herself, and I asked what time they closed, and she confirmed closing was at 8pm. I arrived at 655pm, shortly after speaking with Kristie, the owner. Regular business hours they close at 8pm.  Modified hours right now, they actually closed at 6pm. I was upset and frustrated. Couldn't believe she didn't know when her own business closed!

name: Lee Werling
text: Jay replaced the battery in my iPhone6 in less than 30 minutes. I appreciate his professionalism and taking the time to respond to several iPhone related questions.  Very reasonable cost.  I highly recommend Cell Phone Rehab.

name: larry wright
text: Great place and service

name: Sam Tyson
text: OMG !! This place is wonderful! My front camera didn’t work for some reason and the Owner( Ms Christi Russell) was so polite and helpful. She was able to fix it ASAP no problem and she saw I had a cracked screen protector and gave me a brand new one for being patient I really appreciate them every time I come. Y’all ROCK !

name: Kathy Lewis
text: They were able to order the part I needed to fix my screen on my tablet

name: Carl Martin
text: Amazing costumer service!

name: Angelica Foster
text: I love my phone..  The store owner was very nice and knowledgeable. The young man that repair my phone did an excellent job and he had it ready for me on time. I will go back !

name: Regina Clayton
text: Staff always helpful!!!

name: Hayley Fannin
text: Francis did an amazing and very quick job, I had cracked both the outer and inner screen of my IPhone 7 Plus and me being from out of town I needed it fixed quickly. Very professional and for 100$ cheaper then if I had gone to my normal store back home (WA State). Free screen protector too! Would recommend to anyone who needs a quick repair, and if you want it done right see Francis!

name: CHRISTIANA BARKER-LEE
text: My phone had touch issues and CPR opened my device and as of right now it’s in working condition thanks to static removal. The owner Christi Russell didn’t even charge me. Love Christi for helping me

name: Brenda Abbott
text: Recommended to go here by Sprint to have a broken screen replaced.  Arrived at 4:30 pm to closed sign even though hours are posted until 6 pm.  Cristy let me in and stated they needed to order a new screen because she didn'thave the part in stock..  I was desperate so I paid half and was told it would be in Tuesday am.  Get a quote on Monday from another place for half what I was charged here.  I felt it was a lesson learned and at least I was supporting a local  business.   On Tuesday, screen has not come in.  Promises it will be there Wednesday.  When I call on Wednesday I get disconnected when I press 2 for store and pressing 3 to speak with Cristy and the mail box is full.  Cristy called me back telling me her credit card was compromised and the order was canceled.   She promises it will be in Thursday morning.  No call until Thursday  night at 5:30.  Cristy says she won't be there because it's Halloween but I can drop off my phone and pick it up if I want to come in.  Although I had plans for Halloween,  I cancel so I can get my phone  fixed.  It took longer than expected but was repaired and by looking at the reviews, I am lucky my phone  is working properly.  I was told I would receive a free screen protector but when I picked up my phone was told they didn't have any in stock.  Overall it was not a positive experience and I am pretty sure I paid a lot more than I should have.  I suggest reading the reviews and not just trusting a recommendation from a store or the star rating.  Sign in the store offers 10% off for good social media review.  I now wonder how many of these good reviews were authentic or written for a discount.

name: Jalen Man
text: They did good job

name: WE DEMBoyz
text: My daughter took my son to get his 6plus screen replaced did it quick. The service was great and professional will come again .

name: Toni Smith
text: I LOVED THE EMPLOYEES AT CELL REHAB! EVERYONE WAS SO FRIENDLY AN HELPFUL! IT DIDN’T TAKE LONG FOR THEM TO FIGURE OUT THE ISSUES I WAS HAVING WITH MY PHONE AN OFFER A ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION.  THANKS TO THE STAFF AT CELL REHAB

name: Amber Episcopo
text: I took my HTC One to Cell Phone Rehab in hopes they would be able to fix the shattered screen. No one else would work on it, however, CPR did and now it works wonderfully. They were fast, had the phone ready when promised, very easy to work with. They took the time to answer all my questions, without making me feel like I was wasting their time. I am sure you will not find better service anywhere. I highly recommend using CPR for all your phone repairs.

name: Kamaria Glover
text: The owner and technicians are amazing! They really assist you and make sure you understand everything that is going on with your phone. PLUS they use premium parts WITH a warranty. If you’re looking for a place you can trust, come here!

name: Denise Hodrick
text: Took my son's cellular phone to be looked at .Right away they said it couldn't be fixed . He had a very...... I don't feel like being bothered behavior,like I rather be doing something else besides looking at your broke phone .

name: Bri Rogers
text: Christi and her staff was Amazing. My daughter had disabled my phone and she immediately told me to come in the next day and she made my experience a whole lot better. I will recommend her and her staff to anyone. Thank you for your generosity and taking care of me . -Briuna

name: Andy Johnson
text: Took my phone in for a screen replacement in 12/23 I was assured it would be ready on 12/27. As if 12/31 they say the part hasn't arrived yet. I do not recommend .

name: Micheal Deavers
text: The staff was very helpful and professional. I couldn’t be happier with the repairs they did with my iPhone.

name: Tyler Finkelstein
text: Great experience! Was helped by Keltryn who was fast and professional. Thank you for your help. Will definitely be back if ever in need of cell phone repair.

name: Maxine Wheeler
text: They were very professional and friendly.  I bought a battery for my Galaxy Samsung S7 but didn't realize needed professional to replace battery.  I was able to leave it there for a short time and pick it up.  They had it ready at the time promised. GREAT JOB

name: gregory hines
text: Fast speedy professional service. Phone looks and operates like new. I would recommend this store to anyone. Go by and see Christi for great service and prices are great.

name: chandra mohan kurapaty
text: They fixed the phone in the timely manner, their staff discussed the issue with the phone very clearly and they didn't charged me more than what was initially quoted. Also they gave warranty for 6 months. I am totally happy with them.

name: Brian Canady
text: Always a pleasant experience with these guys. They are friendly, knowledgeable, and most importantly they stand behind their repairs. I've had two different phones worked on by them, and both times they kept me updated through the entire repair process, and when I got them back, they were good as new. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to get their phone, computer, game system or any other electronic device repaired.

name: Miss WaConda Nolan
text: I had my light kit replaced on my IPhone 6 Plus on September 25th. This is the best place to have cracked screens in addition to any other issues your cellular phone may experience. Please inquire about this amazing light kit. Customer for Life.

name: Rick Love
text:
New name  New Management  New  professional attitude.  Nice  waiting area.  Very Clean,  Very polite  team.
Work area  is  super clean and  tech team  are the best.     When you need help,  call these folks

name: diane thomas
text: Open on Sunday's and repaired my Samsung S8 plus that was completely DEAD in less than 1 hour and Verizon told me that it would never work again

name: Dama Darby
text: This was the second glass screen I had repaired with them. The first was great.  The second they had glue oozing everywhere out of my phone. The glue to put the new glass on was not cleaned up and even was on my front camera. I don't take self-esteem but this was messed up. It was a S4. I not have upgraded to the S7 Edge. They need to be more  neater with their work. This was like a year or so ago. The people were nice and the work fast, but sloppy.

name: Jimmy Jacobs
text: Took my LG G4 in with unresponsive screen.  Analyzed and performed troubleshooting process.  While the tech was unable to find a solution, his work and manner were outstanding.  I would return to them in future with other problems and recommend the shop highly.

name: Octaviea Dean
text: This Customer Service was Absolutely amazing and it definitely took them no time at all to get my iPhone 6s Plus looking good as new!! Very much so appreciative!!

name: Shaun Padgett
text: This store is now under new ownership and new management... The location has been completely remodeled inside and out as well as stocked with all of the newest cell phone accessories available. The technician was very knowledgeable and had my phone back to me in about an hour.

name: Berkleigh Davidson
text: So amazing !

name: Wayne Cumbie
text: I would not recommend. The owner told me they had an Apple certified tech. This is untrue. I was told I needed a screen when my issue was they phone would not turn on. A new screen did not fix and was given the phone back unfixed. I sent it back to Apple who said the phone was damaged internally which left the phone beyond repair. My experience with this company is that I would not trust them with an expensive phone. The owner seemed hasty to sell screen and promised a lot. In my experience I found a young man were there that was not that knowledgeable. The owner explained her boyfriend who did most repairs was busy. Buyer beware.

name: Latranza Gordon
text: The service is great n quick. I will definitely do business with them again.

name: Minh N
text: Service was nice, fast and prices were good. The phone looked good after repair. Kristie was very nice.

name: Christopher Walker
text:
1. The place stinks like a dirty ashtray when you walk in.
2. A disheveled employee approached me--he was polite--I'll give him that
3. I asked about a new screen for my iPhone 6S+
4. He said, "Wow, those are so new and hard to get. The screen alone will cost $299.00!"
4a.--The above is NOT true--the screen even at the most expensive offering is $180.
4b.--It is NOT hard to get
4c.--If you go to a true Apple store (i.e. Summit Birmingham)--they will replace your screen while you wait for $149.00. CPR with their prices could literally take your phone to B-ham and have lunch and still earn over $200 per phone (when you include labor). Wouldn't be surprised if that is what they do. The guy that waited on me knew the price at the Apple Store when I mentioned it. That is pure speculation on my part; but, this CPR place is a mess and totally unprofessional.

My advice--take a trip to the Apple Store (get an appointment first) and the folks there will make your phone like new for $149. The money you'll save will more than pay for the trip and you'll have enough left over to enjoy a nice lunch at all the great restaurants at "The Summit."

If you MUST get your phone repaired in Montgomery--I suggest "Total Cell Phone Repair." They charge parts + $55 labor--or $235. That's still expensive; but, at least they are honest on the price of the screen. CPR charges $299 JUST FOR THE SCREEN alone--Absolute "Rip-Off" If there labor charges are the same as most--$55.00/hour--that would be $350.00 price tag!!

name: Sam Caudill
text: I got a price that was equivalent to how much it should have coated to fix my Nexus 6 properly, which ran me $290 (big phone screen and nice glass, and $20 for a warranty to fix it if the screen breaks again which they said they wouldn't do after it broke) Except the problem is that the glass they replaced is not the same kind of glass the phone comes with. The glass broke from stress in my pocket while I was at work standing (I'm a cashier), and the phone continues to crack from just being set down. Honestly they did get it fixed properly but they didn't uphold their promise to make it "good as new". They overcharge for cheap glass so you may as well not fix your screen.

name: Foxx Hound
text:
New management which has a new Professional set up. Excellent customer service. Quality work. I Highly recommend.

Mike Grissom of Capitol Hyundai

name: Tori Jackson
text: Worst experience for the last few weeks.. I was told that I would have my iPhone back within 3 days and I have been dealing with CPR for about 3 to 4 week. Within these 3 to 4 weeks I have been more than 5 times and nothing was ever complete. when I got my phone back. My center button was perminately pressed in. So I called back (this should have never happened anyways) and told the guy what was up and we discussed me coming back on Monday (my ONLY off day) and the shop NEVER OPENED. nor was there even a number to leave a message. As a customer I feel this was disrespectful. Because not once was I called this time or the Times before to be told "I'm sorry your device is not ready or, your part didn't come in" anything to prevent me from driving all the way from where I live which is not in the city of Montgomery. The amount of gas that has gone though my car just traveling back and forth to this place is unspeakable.. Because the site  never opened Monday, I took the phone to another repair place only to be told "the hole for this phone is too small. This isn't the right screen." ... So, I paid over 100 dollars to be given back a phone that isn't properly fixed. how can you give a customer back a phone that isn't properly fixed and that's the whole point of the store. I feel like that is SO shady because I did my part. There is no way this couldn't have been seen. My phone stays on voice control constantly which is SO annoying and half the time I can't even control it. I want my money back.

name: Theresa Taylor
text: Workers are good at what they do. But it really took longer than really expected to fix phone due to being sent sub par part...not their fault. But it was a very expensive fix. But the work has done well.... And have not had any issues so far.

name: Bethany Deairy
text: Christi and her tech team show exemplary service! She does everything she can to help you and has you out in a timely manner.

name: Pre'Knechia Carter-Stokes
text:
One word, unprofessional.
My girlfriend and I went into this place expecting her iPhone 6 Plus to be fixed, it ultimately wasn't. We paid $220 and I also paid a rush fee for the screen to come in next day. It did come in next day but here is where the issue came ...
They "fixed" the screen but once my girlfriend got it to the car, the screen still wasn't working. They said it was a defective screen. OK fine, they order another. They put it on and it still doesn't work. I'm just thinking at this point that they don't know what they are doing. So they refund the rush fee. My girlfriend paid CASH to them for these repairs. She requests a refund and they only give her $130 one day and they said come back. Why ? We paid you cash the first time, why would we come back. She agrees and then we come back almost 3 days later asking for the remainder of the refund. He slings open the register and says, "I only have $50 you can either take this or come back." He said it like we were inconviencing him when we gave them three days to get cash. He offers to put the rest on the card, and this was Monday. It's now Thursday and no sign of the refund in sight. Don't go here. Please go to a certified Apple Specialist.

name: De'Shun Thrasher
text: Would rate them lower if I could. Got my cracked iPhone X screen repaired and it glitched the next day. They agreed that it was a fault in the screen but never ordered a replacement. Only lied and had me coming up there about 3 times a week. Also very quick to ignore phone calls once they see you have a problem that they're trying to dodge.

name: nerilis santiago
text: I went to your store on May 11, ordered the part, paid 50% and I was told that the was supposed to come in the next week. I went back a couple of weeks  later to told that the part was not in but in a couple of days they would have the part will be in and nothing. I called on June 6th and I was told that they were going to talk to the owner about it and call me back. He did called me back and told that the part is coming in the next day. That was on June 6. I was finally able to coming on June 17th just to find out that the still didn't have the part. I contacted the owner and she proceeded to text me, so I took it as her way for me to contact her. I send her a message trying to find a solution to this situation and the owner calls me back, tells me she didn't read my message and begins to yell at me and telling me all her  personal things. I tried to sympathize with her and she continued been rude and belligerent. She never gave me the opportunity to explained myself. She asked if I wanted the cellphone repair or my money back. I told her that I wanted my money back and she hang up. I contacted the store and told them my decision just for them call 20 minutes later and telling that they ordered the part. How am I supposed to still doing business with them when the owner, as she identified herself, treated a costumer in that way.

name: Comoletha Jamison
text: The owner Christie is a life saver, we had 4 devices down all in less than 3 days, and her and her crew fixed them ALL in less than 24 hours. Thanks love and look out for my family, friends, etc.

name: Marina Z
text: Great customer service. Very fast. Decent prices. Highly reccomend.

text: Love It Everyone is nice and took great care of me and my phone. I recommend everyone who asks me if i know of a place to get my phone fixed i send them to CPR montgomery

text: The best place in town! Their technicians are certified and friendly. Can have your device repaired in less than and hour if the part is in stock or by the next day if they have to order it.

name: John Eidsmoe
text: Courteous, knowledgeable, fixed my phone in a few short minutes.  Recommend highly!

name: Kwanesia Wright
text: Hit my phone on a chair at work and the screen goes out then black, blue, purple, green, and white. Screen is fudged...called and spoke with a representative and said I’ll be in on my lunch break. Long story short phone is working again

name: Amy Kim
text: the staff is very nice and it was ready quickly and the price was nice too

name: akersfam
text:
This business is awful and a rip off!!! Take your repair money to the Apple store or reputable shop! Overpriced, shoddy work by novices, super low quality repair parts, and their “warranty” claims are a total scam- YOU WILL pay twice to fix the unrepaired original problem!  We spent $130 on an iPad cracked screen repair.  When we received it back we had 3 new issues: off-center digitizer, inoperative digitizer and inoperative home key. Despite big talk about warranty, manager/owner Kristy blew us off on 5 separate attempts to allow them another repair opportunity, even with us having to pay again!

We paid another $100 to a reputable/professional repair shop, and repair was done flawlessly for less money. The new guy saved the home key to show us how jacked up the repair was,  and proved that the “damaged lcd” they contended was total BS (it works and looks beautiful now, and we did not replace the lcd!)

This IS NOT a reputable repair place. DO NOT trust them with anything other than a $10 phone screen protector replacement, and make them do the repair in your presence.

If this is the only scathing review here, feel free to disregard. But if this isn’t the only very poor review, then heed the warning and don’t go here. This outfit will be out of business within the year, all due to Kristy and her philosophy of ripping off and gouging hard working customers like you, and very likely worsening or ruining your expensive phone or tablet.

JM Akers

name: Donald Chavis (Bubba)
text:
Do not go between 3:30 and 5 pm. High traffic, low staff.
If Christi contacts you about purchasing your phone or equipment, make sure she knows exactly what you have. I drove there to sell my iPhone 5, after 40 mins of her testing my phone she realized it was not a 5s, my ad clearly stated my phone was a 5. I'm sorry does not replace your time or effort.
They do seem technically knowledgeable, but have not grasped the customer service aspect of the business yet.

name: Jennifer Pope
text: Fast and friendly service! I highly recommend.

name: Eden Thornton
text: Droid Moto Z Play needed new screen.  Went to pick up three different times.  Each time, there was a section of the screen that was not adhered properly.  Each time received a different excuse.  They finally fixed it and delivered it to my office on a Friday.  BTW, they put my SIM card in someone else's phone.  I had to spend an hour at Verizon having a new SIM card programmed.  Sorry Gold I-Phone 7 user, whose phone they placed my SIM card in.  It's my understanding that when we got the reprogrammed one, our old one, in your phone, quit working.  Hope you enjoyed your CPR experience as much as I did.  I gave it back to my child on Sunday evening.  He sat in the den and played on it.  By Monday evening the screen went blue / purple.  By Tuesday morning, it was solid black.  The phone is in an Otterbox with a screen protector and he literally did not leave the chair with it.  Now I am out $220 and have a phone that still does not work.

They truly know their products & programs when it comes to Apple iRipoff's (kidding, kind of) & Samsung. text: With trepidation I sent my iPad and Samsung cell phone in by a friend to CPR for repair expecting a costly fix and a long wait time. I usually incur long drives from the country or drive backs, long  wait times and unexpected additional cost for most everything. As promised the repairs were made promptly and inexpensively.  Moreover, everything works perfectly, was nicely cleaned and I received a new iPad holster free within an a couple hours including drive time.  Good job new management!

name: Jeff Grossman
text: Was quoted a price for my cell to sell to them since had a cracked screen etc.. But still a new galaxy 3 used 2 weeks... after beating down to almost nothing said heck with it cut him a deal to repair screen 200.00 bucks so agreed, then when asked to just transfer the minor pics etc... wanted to reduce selling price by 50%... little rude to boot.. left to think it over ( cool) off a little over the scam...Get back after removing and transfer data etc,,,. says still buy drive all the way back (Oh no money today)????? ok, be tomorrow ... drive all the way down AGAIN....OH NO MONEY TO BUY...Unreal... the young man taller guy less techno prepped was helpful and over all nice guy...derrick I think was the nut buster... other guy today cool...maybe other little one's rings..etc..mad him ill.... lol

text: Fast nice service and great customer service. The owner is wonderful!!!

name: stephen price
text: Had a fantastic experience at Cell Phone Rehab. Christy, was very helpful and explained exactly what they could do to repair my iPad and how long it would take. Everyone was so helpful and courteous and great care was taken to repair my iPad as economically as possible. Would not hesitate to recommend Cell Phone Rehab to anyone in need of help getting their phone or iPad back up and running! Hands down the best place to go! You will not be disappointed!

name: Noah Cox
text: I had to wait 4 days and go in 4 different times just to get a battery replaced. Unprofessional and inexperienced staff. In the end I had to go somewhere else to get it fixed. Don't let them touch your phone.

name: David Kryger
text: Made my iPhone brand new. Quick service at a great price.

name: Jonathan Law
text:
Absolutely horrible, shockingly bad experience. I have never in my life dealt with such an unprofessional group of people. Before I brought my phone to these people, every single thing on it worked perfectly. The only issue I had is that there was a scratch on the left side of the screen that irritated me. So I tried to do the right thing and support a local business (or at least a business in the area). On August 5, 2015, I prepaid $161.49 for a screen and service for an iPhone 6. I was told that I would be notified when the parts arrived.

Days go by, and I don't hear from them. I had to call on the 11th and finally ask what exactly was going on. They had an excuse about how their delivery of parts was delayed. Either way, they'd have it the next day. So I'm pretty understanding, and I agree that'd be fine. I take the phone in on August 12. Again, they do not call me - I had to turn up and see whether it was done. I wait approximately 10 minutes after arriving since they were apparently still working on it. Everything looked good initially when I got it back, but I started noticing problems almost right away on the phone.

There was an absolutely immense battery drain on the phone, but more importantly than even that was the ambient light sensor not working, the backlighting at the top of the phone was WAY off, (and they should have noticed that if nothing else if they repair phones for a living) and the proximity sensor wasn't working. If you don't know what a proximity sensor is, when you hold a smartphone up to your head to talk, it shuts the screen off so it doesn't register contact with the screen. It makes it very difficult to use your phone as a phone when it isn't working. The next day, on August 13, I call them back and explain the issue. They agree to take a look at it again and see if there's something they missed. I understand that sometimes, these things happen.

Can't make it there before close on August 14, but I do arrive on August 15th. Another employee looks at the phone, and says that there's just an issue with the screen at this point. They'll have to order another screen to resolve these issues. It's frustrating, but I understand, and I agree, and ask them to contact me when it is in. I waited 10 days, and heard nothing from them. Called a little late in the day on August 25th, and I was told that they got the part in either the day before or that day. So, I mean, thanks for the heads up, right? Can't make it there that day, so I take it in on August 26th.

On August 26th, I drop the phone off yet again around 12:00. The employee says they're a little backed up, but they should hopefully have it ready in about 2 1/2 hours. I told him it was fine. Close to that time later, I got a call saying the screen was on the phone, and they were going to test the other functions. Got another call later, and they told me that the screen was working fine, but that they could not get the proximity sensor to work. They claimed to have tested different parts, but they simply could not get the proximity sensor to work on the phone. I asked how we intended to resolve this issue, especially since it worked when I brought it to them.

I was told that they could either place a damaged screen on the phone (not my original screen in this case, but one that was much, much more damaged) and get a refund, or that basically, I'd have to live with it. This is literally three weeks to this point, and I absolutely need that telephone. Time I don't have it almost always translates to lost productivity. So essentially, my choice was to get my phone back in worse shape than I brought it in, and get my money back, or to keep the screen and they don't fix an issue they caused. I essentially had no real choice in the matter. I am contacting my credit card company to get my money back. They are a terrible business, and your money would be better spent anywhere else. They should be ashamed, but they're not.

name: Tyler Barranco

text:

Muy buen servicio y muy rápido se los recomiendo y sobre todo la amabilidad del personal 👍👏

When my daughter asked if she worked there the girl smiled and said she works both places sometimes. Thats terrible buisness. According to the neighbors arou d this so call buisness they do this alot. You need people who are actually going to stay and work and focus on our phones and not be working 2 jobs at once! I recommend going to celebration in the mall by the food court. Super nice, knowledgeable, and they put 100% focus on you and your repair only.

resp.text: James, thank you for your honest review. Our employee that was supposed to be at work got sick, had to leave and we did not have anyone available to come in on short notice. text: They changed out my screen on my IPHONE 6PLUS.  Now Siri no longer works or Facetime. I call them and they're reply is software issue.  I even told them that it has no volume with doing a face video.  LIKE REALLY???????? They think we are all stupid and don't know how to research a problem.  Consumer beware, THEY DON'T WARRANTY THEIR WORK!!! Their goal is to get your money and that's it. If you have another problem.....they'll just charge you for that as well.

name: Cliff Carlisle
text:
Eastdale Mall/ Montgomery, AL

DONT DO IT!! Horrible customer service. Terrible products (their brand) Good luck getting in touch with the manager. The reviews here must be from employees.

I had a screen break. They fixed it. Took an incredibly long time. I walked around for a little while and the guy who started fixing my phone was texting his fingers off until I interrupted him to ask if he was done with my phone (Of course not). After getting my phone back and insisting on an Otter Box the employee (Ferris) convinced me that the glass screen protector he had could break, BUT IT WOULD SAVE THE PHONE'S SCREEN. He even showed me where it saved the store's IPad. Having a thinner phone than with the Otter Box had its appeals, I even bought a minimal case to be extra sure. After a week of babying my phone, I made the mistake of bending over with it in my front pocket (3ish ft fall). Glass protector and the screen shattered. I was pretty pissed.

Went back to the store. New girl (Magen) seemed a little overwhelmed with helping other people so I was relatively nice to her. She told me that Ferris was promoted to manage his own store (watch out).I told her the story and asked for a refund of the defective glass screen and plastic case (both failed at doing their job and cost me another screen). She refused because she didn't have the authority. I asked to speak to the manager and she called him from her cell phone and walked outside (abandoned kiosk in the eastdale mall could have been costly) left me there and came back. Nope, the manager wouldn't do anything either, and I wasn't allowed to speak to him (STORE POLICY!!!!) She cut $10 off the new glass screen and gave me the managers email address.

I am only writing this after attempting to contact the manager for the past two weeks(Chris Vick) I'm normally not the kind of guy that would do this. However, this business has terrible products that promote future phone screen replacements (kind of brilliant), have terrible customer service and even worse management.

$400 taught me a valuable lesson about Cellairis...If I ever break my phone again, Ill support the Arabs a few kiosks down.

name: Ginger Lewis
text: I pick up Wish orders here sometimes. The owners are super friendly. The wife makes jewelry from some of the parts from inside old computers! Very unique and very affordable! Lots of extras in this hidden gem! 😉

name: Mary Moore
text:
I brought in my Dell laptop as I could not get it out of an "infinite boot loop" or "infinite restart." I ended up getting a new laptop and a data transfer. I interacted with all three team members listed on the site and they were all friendly and professional. The building is clean and organized.

However, I dropped it off at noon on a Thursday for it to be tested as they believed it was something else. The receipt/contract sheet I was given said 1-2 business days, but it ended up being 7 before they got to my computer, not counting Sunday. By this point I had already purchased a new laptop and decided I just wanted a data transfer. This was my first time using this business so I have no idea if this is indicative of the average wait period. I know they experienced property damage recently due to the snow storm and I would imagine that would set their workflow back a good bit. I like to give people the benefit of doubt.

They also sell a wide variety of new and used electronic products and when I went in the first time they even had a lot of unrelated merchandise jewelry, stickers, etc.

4/5 overall good experience. I normally don't leave reviews but I was impressed enough by this.

name: Jarmarcus Lewis
text: Tervor was very condescending with his remarks about my role as a customer. I did not feel that he valued my business. He offered other places that I take my business instead of assuring that my product would be repaired in the timely manner. I am sure that Tervor will not miss my one repair job, and his business will continue on.  However, ever customer is important to some businesses and I will spend my money at them.

resp.text:
My grandfather had a saying, "when you tell half truths, you deal in all lies."

I did call you, left a voicemail, saying that I didnt appreciate the way you spoke with my staff, and that your system had been here only 8 Business Days, when the repair time clearly posted at time of drop off was 10 business days. I told you that based on that you would have your system with Saturday or Monday, but in your review you state I didn't assure you when it would be repaired "in a timely manner", however I did tell you when, and it was timely based on the posted repair wait at time of drop off.

You state I offered other places, that is possibly the only true part of your review. I offered the other places around that could get to your repair if the wait wasn't doable for you.

You stated you was a "manager of a big box store" and that you "worked for AT&T" and that you don't treat a customer like this. To which I informed you I was "not a big box store, and I wouldn't let anyone treat my employee's wrongly."

Upon further looking into this, another lie came out. You are not a manager at AT&T, just a sales person. I know this, cause our business has over 55 lines with AT&T.

I hope you take this opportunity to learn to treat people the way you want to be treated, cause if you treat my staff improperly, I will call you out.

name: Barry Reding
text: My son took his computer to these people last Saturday. The technician told him the problem was most likely to he power supply and showed him the power supply that was needed. My son saw the price tag on the power supply read $80. Today (Wednesday) at 3pm my son went to pick up the computer because they hadn’t fixed it. They require a $35 deposit and would not give him the money back because it is non refundable. They did no work to the computer. I found this shady to say the least given the fact they did no work. I called and after being passed off to four different people I questioned the deposit. I was told by all four people that the deposit was necessary because people bring their computers there and never come to pick them up. I pointed out that was not the case here. I then asked if I could come there and purchase the power supply for $80 minus the $35 that had already been paid. At first the answer was yes you can do that but we won’t guarantee the part. I said I was fine with that. As the conversation progressed and I pressed for a solid answer on the purchase person number four (apparently the top of the ladder there) he began to to fish tail. He said power supplies can range in price. I reminded him the technician actually showed the power supply to my son that was needed for his computer. The price tag said $80. He said you can bring the computer back and we will look at it before the EOB today. At this point I wouldn’t trust these people to hold a penny. Person number four hung up me. It’s a scam. Stay away from these people.

resp.text:
Your system was dropped off on Saturday.  There is a sign clearly posted that it is currently 3 business days before a technician gets to your repair.  You choose to come pick up your system before the technician got to it on the 3rd business day (it was the next item on his list to work on for the record).  You spoke with 3 separate people when you asked for a refund on the non-refundable deposit every customer pays at drop off.  All 3 offered to have you bring the system back with no additional deposit for the technician to work on the system.  The technician even offered to work on the system immediately if you brought it back in today.  You refused.  One of the owners agreed to your request that the deposit be applied to purchase of a power supply, even though there is no verification that a power supply will fix the system.  This did not satisfy you either.  Services have been offered multiple times.  The bench fee is clearly covered at drop off and with signs on the counter at drop off.  If you had chosen to bring the system back, the $35 bench fee would be applied to your over all bill.  No one from our store told you to come pick up your system, what was wrong with it, or that we could not fix it.  We still offered you services that you choose to refuse.

The offers were made by multiple employees as well as one of the owners. All calls are recorded and the offers were recorded as well. The security video and audio is available upon request. And the offer still stands, you are welcome to bring it back in or apply the deposit to anything in store, same as owner offered on phone.

We strive for 100% satisfaction from every client, at every interaction.  We want you to become family, and I hope you feel you have.

Thank you for your trust and support! One day, maybe, you will get to teach one of our little ones in high school!

text: Would not recommend them. I called to see about having them build a gaming pc for me. I was having to wait for the funds but figured why not touch base & see if this was something they could do. He said he could. A week later I called back to schedule an appointment for going over what I wanted in the build. I told the person on the phone I had talked with Trevor about it last week and now have the funds for the build. She rudely told me i needed to schedule an appointment. I thought to myself does this person not understand that's what I'm trying to do? I just said nevermind I will order one on the net. Which I did through iBuyPower.com They lost business because of the bad attitude of the person who answered the phone They gave off a better than you attitude. I honestly wanted to use a local business to help the area economy during the Covid-19 pandemic. To bad I didn't get to

resp.text:
Aaron, this is Trevor.  I attempted to contact you after you spoke to Lakin via facebook, never did anyone, other than myself speak to you over the phone. You blocked our business account and wouldnt answer personal messages. I have screenshots and will be glad to send them to you.

The person you talked to on Facebook didnt know you wanted to set up and appointment and was suggesting you did. She had not been the one dealing with you and didnt know we had talked.

We attempted to contact you several times to fix this and you wouldnt respond,  and blocked the message where I was talking to you.

I am sorry you feel she was rude, however she didnt know and was suggesting an appointment to save you time. Please check your messages as you can see I personally tried to talk to you.

name: Allison England
text: Stay Away, I took my repair in over 2 months ago. He told me parts are over seas. He is never open, does not answer the phone, ignores my calls. Thief!

resp.text:
We apologize that you feel we could do something to get parts here faster. Due to the COVID19 Pandemic, lock downs, and shutdowns in our Country as well as in many companies’ factories are in, such as China and Japan, parts have become hard to get. When they do arrive, they must clear customs. Normal shipping from overseas is 2-4 weeks, without any delays. We work as hard as possible to keep our customers happy, however some things are out of our control. Shipping is one.

As far as phone calls, our office is manned Mon-Fri 9AM-6PM, there is an auto attendant and Voice Mail should we be on other line. We also have email available on our drop off forms for customers to contact. If you have any questions please email me at info@nextgencomputers.net.

Please also give me the name your repair is registered in, as we do not have anything in the name "Allison England" and I will be glad to look into why it took so long.

name: Brad Davidson
text: Children in business! unprofessional,

resp.text:
We are a small business that is FAMILY owned. With the current COVID19 crisis there is no other options if we want to work than to bring our children to our office. Furthermore, we believe it is important to instill in them a good work ethic so they can learn they have to work for what they want, and not expect it to be handed to them.

Our technicians are 100% certified, and as such, all adults. Children being here doesn't change our business practices or our ability to serve clients. It only shows the world, what a TRUE family owned business is!
