name: Mark Adams
text: I was looking for a good Galaxy phone and Delvan went the last mile to get me the S20 that I've been looking for.   He transferred my contacts and pictures.    Great customer service!@!

resp.text: Hi Mark! We are so glad we were able to help! It's our mission to ensure our customers are #GenuinelyHappy, and we are so thrilled we were able to make that happen for you. Awesome job Delvan!

name: MD.Shoumik Sadaf
text: Very Bad experience. I wanted to get a connection of at&t pre-paid for my friend as he is new in USA. The At&t person couldn’t say about anything related to the service and plan. He even couldn’t answer to our questions and sold to us postpaid instead of pre-paid that also on my name instead of my friend’s name. We went there thrice after that incident and they couldn’t help us related to switching the account or canceling it. Very bad service and unexpected from a brand like AT&T.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for bringing this to our attention. We do our best to equip our team to assist customers and apologize that this was not the case. We are sorry this happened to you. Your experience in the store matters to us. We will work with our employees to improve our customer's experience.

name: Fannie Powell
text: Delvan Houston took time and made sure that my plan was correct.  He made sure EVERYTHING was fine.  Be sure to see Delvan and his Staff, they are phenomenal.

resp.text: Hi Fannie! Good to hear! We are so happy we were able to help! Thanks for being the best part of AT&T!! Great job taking care of the customer, Delvan!

name: Nicole Nesbitt
text: Delvan was outstanding and he lowered my bill.  He went beneath and beyond to help me.

resp.text: Hi Nicole! So glad we were able to help! We LOVE hearing about the wonderful experiences our customers are having in our stores! Thanks for being a loyal AT&T customer!! Great job taking care of the customer, Delvan!

name: T M
text: Very friendly staff, great experience. Zariah and Thomas were very helpful and took their time with me. Will be back. The Manager walked me to the door and was very helpful as well.

resp.text: Hi T M! Great to hear! Thank you for sharing your experience with us! Look forward to seeing you in our store again!

name: Hope Landrum
text: Delvan is the BEST! He was so patient and stayed late to help us transfer from another provider. Go see Delvan!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Hope! We are so glad we were able to help! It's our mission to ensure our customers are #GenuinelyHappy, and we are so thrilled we were able to make that happen for you. Awesome job Delvan!

name: Dyamond B
text: I received help from Mr. Delvan Houston and it has been the best and easiest experience i've had in my 12 years with this company. I am extremely grateful for his assistance and the time he took with patience for me and my family!

resp.text: WOW!! We LOVE hearing about the wonderful experiences our customers are having in our stores, and it's even better when our store reps get a shout out!! Great job Delvan! It is our mission is to make our customers #GenuinelyHappy, and I'm so excited that we made that happen for you, Dyamond!! Thanks for being a loyal AT&T customer!!

name: Danny Nesbitt Jr
text: See Delvan Houston and staff.  Great customer service.

resp.text: Hi Danny! Thanks for the compliments! So glad we were able to help, and we look forward to seeing you in our store again. Awesome job Delvan!

name: Cedric Roberson
text: Everyone was very nice and friendly. Zeriah had the best customer service skills I've saw in awhile.

resp.text: Hi Cedric! Great to hear! Thank you for sharing your experience with us! Look forward to seeing you in our store again!

name: Dion Peoples
text: Great location, staff super friendly. I was in and out very quickly.

resp.text: Hi Dion! Great to hear! Thank you for sharing your experience with us! Look forward to seeing you in our store again!

name: Anna Hammond
text: Greg was fantastic. Super helpful and kind. He saved me money and upgraded my family plan to unlimited and got me the deal to trade in my iPhone 8 to receive the 12 for a great price. Great experience.

resp.text:
Hey Anna!
We are so happy to hear that Greg was able to help you get more bang for your buck with our new unlimited data plans and promotions! Thank you very much for taking the time to leave us a review with great feedback!

Thank you,
Christine Sell
Assistant Store Manager

name: Joey Yarbrough
text: Quantez  was amazing. We added a lot of phone lines. Took a long time complete. His patience was remarkable. Thank you so much.

resp.text:
Joey,
Thank you for expressing how great Quantez was in assisting you add lines to your account. He truly enjoyed helping you and will look forward to helping you anytime in the future!

name: Rickey Elliott
text: Jason & Matthew went all out to make sure my wife and I got our phones changed over and were getting the signal strength we needed at our new home. Really much more help than we ever expected. Thank you guys. You’re the best.

resp.text:
Rickey,
It was an absolute pleasure for Jason and I to spend time with you checking the signal and helping you get switched over. We were more than happy to help you as well as if any of your friends need help we will offer the same help to them as well! We loved seeing the Mustangs and look forward to helping you with any future needs!

name: Dee Sneed
text: I was greeted when I entered the store, and I didn’t have a long wait. Jason was very nice and helpful and searched for any discount that I might be eligible for while upgrading my daughter’s phone.   He didn’t oversell when he found out that my cell service was with another carrier and provided me a quote in case I decided to switch!  I received EXCELLENT customer service!

resp.text:
Hey Dee!
It was a great time having you in store. Thank you for leaving Jason a review! Jason does his very best to get the best deal for every one of his customers. We appreciate you and your business.

Thank you,
Christine Sell
Assistant Store Manager

name: Janice Houston
text: Great customer service and all the reps and Store Manger was very courteous and friendly as well as helpful.

resp.text: Hi Janice! Great to hear! Thank you for sharing your experience with us! Look forward to seeing you in our store again!

name: Mohamad Menati
text: Helpful and knowledgeable staff. Justin was my sales associate. He was very nice and helpful. Happy for doing business with them.

resp.text:
Mohamad,
Thank you for expressing how great the staff was in assisting you. If you have any needs in the future come visit us again!

name: Bria Johnson
text: Quantez was extremely helpful in assisting with setting up my new phone! He even went the extra mile and applied my screen protector. I definitely recommend going to see him and the wonderful staff at our local AT&T store!

resp.text:
Bria,
Thank you for taking the time to leave such a great review of your experience with Quantez. Each time you visit i hope you continue to have this experience!

name: David Marxer
text: Greg Smith, the Auburn, Alabama sales associate who assisted me, was very professional, friendly, and helpful as he explain all of the features of most models of smart phones. I selected an iPhone 11 and he encouraged me to consider switching to AT&T TV. After reviewing features of my current cable provider, I returned to the store the next day to purchase the AT&T TV package. Excellence!

resp.text:
David,
Thank you for taking the time to tell all about your experience with Greg. He always takes his time with customers and i am glad to hear you had such a great experience!

name: Jada Shealey
text: Great environment. Everyone was friendly and helpful. They made me feel comfortable. And Torrey he was nice and did everything he could to get me the best price and nice phones!

resp.text:
Hey Jada!
We had a pleasure having you and your family in the store and getting your switched over to AT&T. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review!

Thank you again,
Christine Sell
Assistant Store Manager

name: Nia Denham
text: Jason took great care if my husband and me today.    Not only did he help us switch my phone over from Verizon, but he also set up the AT&T app on my phone and showed me how to log into HBO Max.   He was extremely knowlegeable while being friendly and professional.    I think my family will be seitching all our lines to AT&t soon, if everyone here is as helpful and knowledgeable as Jason.

name: Ryan Moore
text: So I went into the store at 6:40 PM and they were closing at 7 PM which is something I normally don’t do to people. I really needed to get my phone issue taken care of though. During the process of trying to get my phone active and getting my plan started we ran into several obstacles that required multiple calls to other departments inside of AT&T. Not once did I sense any frustration or irritability because these calls where having to be made and by this time it was past seven. Actually I was the one being told thank you for my patience even though these guys were staying past closing. Christine and Greg gladly stayed until 8pm making sure but I was taken care of. This may be hands-down the best customer service I’ve ever received. Anyone who’s fortunate enough to have Christine or Greg help them when they go in to the Auburn AT&T store I promise you’ll be just as pleased!

resp.text:

Thank you so much! We sincerely make sure that the customers needs are put first in every situation. name: Austin McAdory
text:
The 5 stars are for Jermaine, the man who spent 2 hours and 14 minutes of his life dutifully fighting through AT&T's abysmal phone system yesterday on my behalf.  It is only because of Jermaine that my simple number port - from an AT&T landline to an AT&T cell phone, which is supposed to take around 20 minutes - is even complete at all.  His diligent slogging through 9 phone support personnel from 5 different departments, including 4 different people from "Porting Activations" (which is apparently based somewhere in Russia...) made us both laugh, and nearly cry, and turned what would have been a soul crushing experience into something I will look back on mostly fondly.

I cannot recommend T-Mobile highly enough after all this, but if you choose AT&T (or if you're contractually glued to them), do yourself a HUGE favor and go see Jermaine at this location if you need any changes made that involve changes to your account itself.

(Note: the other 3 CSRs there all seem very nice too, but I dealt with Jermaine and this is mostly a review of his performance, which was excellent.  Don't let this discourage you from trying one of the others, though.)

P.S. I've noticed some other reviewers say you should try the Tigertown store.  I've been there twice, including earlier in the day yesterday, and they were zero help.  YMMV but this is an official company store, and Tigertown is a re-seller, so I'd seriously consider going here instead.  PLUS THE OTHER STORE DOESN'T HAVE JERMAINE!

name: Avery Arthur
text:
VERY DISAPPOINTED SO FAR
I ordered AT&T Uverse Internet last week and revived my self install package on time. However, due to problems with the lines, my service activation appointment was pushed back two days to resolve the issues. When I called for an update, I was told that the problem had been fixed and that I would be able to install my service after 2:00pm on the new activation date that I was quoted. I followed the instructions and installed my modem, as directed. After waiting an hour for the modem to start up, I still have no broadband service. After speaking with multiple customer service technicians, being told my issues were already resolved more than once, and spending DAYS of my own personal time trying to gain Internet access, I have been informed that I am to pay a technician much more money than I have at my disposal so that he or she might come out and fix the problem for me. If I had the funds to pay for a technician to install my service, I would not have purchased a self-install package. As a result of AT&T's failure to follow through on their promises, my personal life has been hindered, and my work has been delayed well past deadlines. As I stated before, I am extremely disappointed with AT&T.

name: Max Cichon
text:
I find it remarkable that anyone has posted a 5-star review of this place. I've been a wireless customer of AT&T for 12 years and when this place popped up near my work, I decided to use it to replace my upgefukked LG G3.
Big mistake. I cracked the screen, first time ever, and went back to this location and was told, basically I was out of luck. I didn't take the insurance. What insurance? It was never mentioned nor offered.
OK. My bad. I went to 3 different repair centers, non-AT&T, and was quoted ~$100 at each place. After a lengthy wait at each place (7-10 days) I was told the screen on this LG G35 ThinQ was different in camera location from any screens they could get.
Hmmmm...
I went to "first-in-town" AT&T store and was told, and I quote: "...oh. Those stores aren't really AT&T stores. They are "Authorized Re-sellers, only. You should have come here. We don't even sell the G35."
I returned, once again, to the re-seller and we had a Come to Jesus Meeting. I'm big and was pretty TO'ed. They agreed to get it repaired, at my cost, by sending it to LG in Ft. Worth TX. They did fix it. $152.

In short: do NOT use these "re-seller" stores. They are akin to "Big Lots". And have the same policies regarding customer service.

text: Amazing customer service. I had my iPhone X screen replaced with a refurbished screen, but it had some issues initially. It took me a little over a month to be sure it was a problem with the screen and not iOS glitching. Even though I wasn’t able to replicate the problem, he took my word for it and gave me another replacement! Just an outstanding warranty and customer service. Also, he replaced each screen in less than an hour. Not many places will do same day screen repairs like that at a price lower than Apple’s. Can not recommend enough.

name: Drews
text:
DO NOT TRUST THEM FOR BATTERY REPLACEMENTS ON IPHONES.

About a month ago, I got a battery replacement from them on my iphone, and the new one they put in was running out of battery even more than the old one--about 1% per minute--dying at 24%. So, I ran a battery testing app on it, and the replacement they installed performed WORSE than the original battery that was being replaced (the original was over 2 years old!)

So I brought it back to tell the owner, and he had the nerve to put a second garbage battery in my phone. Luckily, I looked at the battery as he was putting it in, and I saw that this "NEW" battery had the serial number literally covered up, with a black marker. I asked him why it was like that, and he stuttered and basically said nothing.

I got my money back and ordered a do-it-yourself kit from amazon, and what do ya know, the battery works great and performs really well on my testing app. These guys are scam artists and they get away with it because most people would never think to act that way.

Be very careful here, or go somewhere else.

resp.text:
Dear Zachary. Sorry for bad experience. We searched in our database we could not find any records.

Could you pls contact us at 205 887 5151

We will be happy to assist you and provide you with new Oem battery. We have warranty with every item we sell. We can contact our vendor to see what is the problem.

Note that sometimes motherboard drains battery dues to shorted caps or diodes.

We will be glad to do free diagnostic.

Please make sure this is the right location, we are located at

111 east magnolia avenue auburn al

Phone Clinic

Do you have any proof that it was not OEM?
We use OEM retina displays. Claim with no proof is just guess. Most probably your frame was very bent.  The main problem with iPhone 6 is that frames will bent easily after dropping it for the first time.

text: Horrible customer service. They said they ordered a screen to repair my broken one, but on the day the screen was to arrive, they had absolutely no record of the location of the screen or even if it had been ordered. They then said it would take one more day, and when I asked the next day, they said three more days. It's been a week of "just a few more days" and still no screen. Steven M, their technician, cannot tell the location of the screen, or even if it has been ordered (even though he supposedly placed the order). Steven doesn't seem terribly concerned about checking the status until I show up in front of him. There is no response to my texts and certainly no pro-active checking on his part. Today I decided that if they cannot even tell whether a part has been ordered or where it is, then they certainly cannot be trusted to actually perform a repair. On top of that, I just realized looking at the receipt that they have listed the wrong model for my phone! I would not recommend this company at all.

resp.text:
Hello Maria,

Please allow me to apologize for the negative experiences you have encountered with our Harbert location. It is never our intention to misquote a repair time, and I am very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations. If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us, our Customer Support team would love to know! At your earliest convenience, please reach out to them at (877)320-2237 Monday through Saturday 10AM to 10PM and Sunday 12PM to 8PM EST. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

text:
I had to go into the store to do an in-person verification. Even after handing the store manager my CDL, the system the store utilizes told me  I wasn't the person I said I am and it indicated I did not live at the address where I stated on my application.

I drove over 45 miles from Birmingham to the Springville location (because that's where the online application sent me to) to be given the run around. I cancelled that order and went to T-Mobile and purchased both service and the new iPhone ProMax 256G. Based on my experience, I will never ever purchase anything from AT&T in the future.

name: GiGi Reviews
text: I live in Birmingham, Alabama. . . . I completed an online application for AT&T new service iPhone ProMax 156G-bits. The application online sent me to Springville, Alabama to the AT&T Store. I am suppose to do a "curbside" pickup. I had a note to call Customer Service before going to the Springville Store. I called CS and the Rep. stated there was missing information on my application. So, he canceled the order because I said I would visit the nearest AT&T Store in Hueytown. The Hueytown AT&T Store did not have the iPhone ProMax phone I had intended to purchase. Therefore, I did not do an application for a new account in the Hueytown Store. I proceeded on to drive 43 miles to the AT&T Store in Springville, Alabama. I arrive at the store and stated I was there to do an application for new service. I hand the Store Manager my driver's license as proof of identity and residence. The manager keyed in the information from my CDL and AT&T Opulence Systems kept kicking the information out stating I wasn't who I am.👀 #ThatsOdd So and for about 20-30 minutes the Store's Manager tried to key in my information until the District Manager called and notified the Store Manager the AT&T Opulence System was having issues processing applications online. Therefore, I utilized my cellular phone to submit again an application for new service and the portal was unstable, flipping through pages before the end-user could complete the online application. However, the application went through and stated the phone would be delivered to my home by April 2021 👀👀👀 At that point, I believed this was an indication I should not patronize AT&T for cellular services. #OrderCanceled4Good

resp.text: Hello GiGi Reviews We do our best to equip our team to assist our customers. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers! We're sorry we fell short of your expectations. Please contact the area manager bryan.hale@liveatt.com so we can find a resolution for you.

text: Went to upgrade a line for my daughter who already had an IPAD with cell service. Then on top of that, I see an email a day later that I was enrolled in ATT's overpriced insurance plan for that new iphone and phone line without my knowledge. Buyer be wary with EVERYTHING they tell you!!!

name: Brock Murphy
text: Always horrible service at the stores.  They are not very knowledgeable about issues that you are having with your phone.  I have two contacts in my phone that call and get sent straight to VM.  It doesn’t show a missed call either.  I ran through 1.5 hours with apple on a chat.  Checked online after they couldn’t fix it and found that the only thing that i had not tried is a new SIM card. I figured what could it hurt i have tried everything else.  He changed my SIM card and gave my phone back to me after checking the usual and asking the same questions that i had already told him that apple support sent me through. He even suggested that if the callers that went straight to VM had my number blocked.  I can call them but they cannot call me.  This doesn’t make any sense.  After a couple of minutes with the new SIM card my service had not activated yet.  I mentioned it to him. He checked the phone line and said that it is a good on his end that it could take up to six hours and if it still did not have service to call att and they would take care of the issue over the phone.  Just one question i have is why are they even there if they have no idea how these things work and if they have to have me call att just to activate my card.  Worthless in my opinion.

resp.text: Hello Brock, This is not the experience we wanted you to have. Please contact the store at 256-331-1927 and ask to speak to a manager so we can get a resolution for you. We want to make this right.

name: Crystal Pitts
text: I went to this store to establish internet service. I paid my $100 deposit in cash and was told my installation date. The day came for installation and no one showed. I reached out to the employee Scott who created my order and he said because of the rain there were delays. I ended up getting an approx. date for installation from Bishop which was on a Sunday(which At&t is closed...so how was that). Of course, no one showed. So I called At&t directly and inquired about it and was told they saw the account created but they saw nothing about my payment or info of an installation date for me. I made another $100 deposit with my debit card directly with At&t & I was advised to go back to the store to obtain a full refund of the cash payment. I've gotten the biggest run around at this store. They tell me I'm going to get my money back and they'd call me but NO ONE EVER CALLS ME WITH ANYTHING! I've constantly had to go out to this store just to see what the status was and they always tell me they are working on it and would call! NEVER HAPPENED! I finally spoke to the manager Sam and he supposedly filled out the necessary paperwork on the computer so I could get my refund sent via check in the mail within six weeks. ITS BEEN 5 MONTHS!! NO CHECK!! Went out there yet again and Scott informs me that Sam's no longer with them and they now have a temp manager and he wasn't going to address him with the issue because he wasn't going to be there long. Scott said the district manager was coming to the store a little later that evening to drop off a customer's phone. He assured he get my concern to the district manager once he arrived at the store and he would call me also once he arrived so I could speak to him. NEVER HAPPENED! I popped up on a different day and spoke to the temp manager and he agreed that it shouldn't have been this complicated and he'd look into it. Come to find out the employee Scott made an error by taking cash instead of a credit/debit card. He rung it up as if I was making a cell deposit which allowed the acceptance of cash because if he rung it up as internet it wouldn't have allowed him to accept cash instead it would've prompted for credit/debit card. The temp manager said he emailed two different people on the cell phone side to see how he can go about obtaining my refund and he said he'd call me. Things felt promising because it seemed he was being genuine! He said he'd called once he heard something(which would take a few days). I've given it almost two weeks and no call no nothing! I called a day ago to speak with the temp manager and Bishop told me he was with a customer. Bishop asked for my name, contact number, and reason for wanting to speak to him. Bishop said he'd have him call and I thought he would since he was in the store. I WAS WRONG! IM STILL YET TO GET ANYWHERE WITH THIS MATTER AND MY PATIENCE IS VERY THIN AT THIS POINT! IM SICK AND TIRED OF THE RUN AROUND! I JUST WANT MY MONEY BACK SO I CAN PUT THIS MATTER BEHIND ME! I'VE BEEN MORE THAN PATIENT AND UNDERSTANDING!!! I know they have other things on their to do list but I feel that my situation should be some form of a priority given that the mistake was on the employee. It shouldn't take over 5 months for this situation to be resolved but when the workers aren't trying to do nothing about it....nothing will get done! Every time I've went out there everyone is just standing around doing the usual. I feel nobody is taking it seriously nor are they putting in a conscious effort to ensure I get my refund!! They never have to be concerned about me coming back to this store after I obtain my money!!!

text:
Scott, I believe that is his name was very helpful when I initially purchased my phone. Although, the store phone rang several times while I was there and the other employees in the store did not answer it.

After finding out that the phone would not work for the purpose I had brought it, I looked to return it. Well this was after several attempts in trying to make it work. I called the store on the 14th day, because I had recently had a procedure and can't drive myself. I was trying to get someone at the store to see how I needed to proceed or if I could proceed, but the phone was never answered on the three times I called  I was given the opportunity to go by the store today on the 15th day and was denied returning my phone.

I understand that there are policies and procedures that have to be followed, but I feel this could have been handled differently. As a manager, I know that some times you have to go against policies to take care of your customers.... Just very disappointed in my service today.

text: To be honest, it was terrible.   I upgraded to a phone with a bad battery and I had the phone less than 3 days.  First. Then,  I was told I had to pay the defective phone off in full before I could do anything.  I had not had the phone 14 days AND it was defective.  I took my products and went to Hamilton.  No paying a restocking fee or paying off a defective phone.  They were happy to swap out a phone and worked with the products I had taken from Winfield.  Just do yourself a favor and don't shop there.

name: Courtney McNaughton
text:
I’ve been with AT&T from the beginning. When it was still Cingular, ha! So, about 21 years now. Anyway...

On Tuesday, 11/02/2020 (Election Day) my iphone went out due to water damage. So, I had to get a new one. I had absolutely NO intention of purchasing ANYthing in store, because of the not so good experiences I’ve had at nearby AT&T stores (Schillinger Rd S) l. I’d rather buy online. Even said that to a friend before I called, ha!
However, I had some questions. So, I googled AT&T. I clicked on the first location that popped up, which happened to be the one in Semmes on Moffett and Schillinger. A young man by the name of Jarius answered the phone. Immediately, I could tell how friendly he was and quite humorous😆 One of those people who you know right off, is just a kind and genuine guy, ya know? He went out of his way to answer the questions I had. Even answered questions I didn’t even ask, but wanted to. Questions that I was afraid to ask. Mainly, because of the last location (Schillinger Rd S) I went to (about a year ago) to get my watch, seemed annoyed and rushed from the very beginning. Which made me feel like a burden rather than a paying customer. It’s actually happened every time I’ve been to that location. Never thought to go to another, because I just assumed that they all act that way. Due to such poor service in the past, it’s now come to the point where I dread having to get any new device from them. Although, that all changed after speaking to Jarius for that brief moment on the phone. After getting the information I needed, I made it a point to go to the Moffett Rd location to purchase my new phone from HIM, specifically. Which ended up being a great decision! I knew exactly who he was when I walked in, based on seeing his pleasant demeanor and friendly facial expressions towards other customers.

He greeted me, and I told him  what I wanted. He didn’t even ask me what color I wanted. Instead, he took it upon himself to bring ALL five colors out, so I could see them up close in order to make my decision. I chose my phone. He took it out of the box...next thing you know———HE has my WHOLE phone set up for me! Even did the facial recognition. This has NEVER happened. From walking in, to leaving, it took about 20 minutes, maybe? Typically, it takes at least an hour to get the phone —which they just give to me to take home and do it myself. Which for me? Takes another hour or two, ha!  By the way, [in the past] I’ve asked them to help me, and they’ve refused. Claiming it’s against policy. Which, I know now, is a lazy lie. It’s been a few days since I’ve gotten my new phone, and yet, I’m still thinking about and telling others of the excellent service I received—sending people their way. Also, I HAVE to mention Tre (the manager) who came over while Jarius was doing his thing. He came over to make sure everything was going smoothly and checked to see if I was getting the best deals they had to offer—which HE made sure I did🙏He was friendly, personable, and just all around pleasant. He didn’t have to come over, because Jarius had it all under control. However,  he did, and I saw him doing that with all of the other customers as well. Those two really want people to be satisfied and it’s completely evident.

I, myself, have worked in customer service for about 15 years. So, I appreciate and know good (great!) service when I see it.  As long as Jarius and Tre are working for AT&T—I will continue to go there. Because I literally put off getting a new phone for 2 years (had it for 4) because it always seemed like a chore any time I was thinking of getting a new one. I know this review is a bit lengthy...but the experience was like no other, that just couldn’t be explained in a short summary. That, and they deserve it! Again, thank you Jarius and Tre!!🤗

name: Chris Matthews
text:
Recently I visited the Verizon Cellular Sales store on Madison Boulevard to discuss temporarily suspending service for my daughter who went to Italy this week for military duty and will be there for two years.  When I arrived Brittany greeted me at the door with a very pleasant personality.  I explained to her and Catherine, also pleasant, my situation and Catherine started the process for the suspension.  Alex was also nearby and provided very good information and advice during my visit.  While Catherine was on hold with the Verizon rep on the phone, she noticed from viewing my account that she could save me money by utilizing the promotion that was ongoing to pay off my daughter's phone and also upgrade my wife's.  Since my wife was at work at that time, I told Catherine and Brittany that I would return with her that evening to take care of everything.  When we returned we were greeted by Christie, one more person with warmth and courteousness, who helped us get started with the process once again.  Our experience was the best one we have had with any Verizon store in town.  We were made to feel right at home, and even when the process hit a snag, through no fault of their own, we were still pleased with the outcome.  Even Scott, who was not involved with assisting us, provided good conversation and hospitality.  In the end, my daughter's services were suspended, my wife upgraded her phone and my bill decreased by approximately $75.  After it was over we were still there 20 minutes later just talking.  We even "adopted" Brittany as our second daughter.  Everyone at that store are valuable assets to the Verizon company and brand.
JOB WELL DONE!

resp.text: Chris, thanks for that shout out! You just made our day. We’re always on the lookout for ways to better serve Cellular Sales customers and you’re helping us to serve even better. We appreciate you! -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Keep Tryin'
text: Became a Verizon Customer based on advertised military rebate flyer and salesperson of $200 per line. The flyer said buy or activate. Small print at the bottom written in legal said it had to be a phone financed thru Vzn. The Vzn sales guy vouched for the flyer. I'm not going to hire a lawyer every time I sign up with a cellular company to read the fine print. When I complained they did not give a reason online. I appealed with no reason given again. So I had to call and talk to a specialist who said it was clearly written.  I said it is not clear. If it's written in the fine print for all the layman folk in the world then we are getting ripped off. We're not going to read the fine print when the sales person said to buy it and it's written at the very bottom in size 5 font.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share, Burt. Please reach out to us with details of your visit at 877-851-0649 or Customerservice@cellularsales.com. -- Cellular Sales Customer Service

name: Jacquelynn Thompson
text: I was disappointed to have an awful experience here about 4 months ago and everytime I step in this store. This is the only store I would go to for the 4 years we have lived here and have always had amazing customer service until now. Their employees are not well trained and I felt they told us whatever we wanted to hear to get us to buy new phones. We had to order our phones and when they came in it too 2 visits and 6 hours to get the phones activated. No one seemed to know what they were doing. We were told we would get a deal for trading in our phones. I'm still waiting for the deal to show on our bill even though I have been in twice to address the situation. They seemed inconvienced to do our trade in and made me come back for a separate visit to do so. Was told they were too busy to deal with everything I needed done on my account. It's disappointing how downhill customer service has gotten and I feel we were ripped off. Next time I will just do everything online myself.

resp.text: Thank you, Jacquelynn, for sharing your experience. If you need any further assistance, please contact our Customer Service Team at  877-851-0649 or customerservice@cellularsales.com. Reference case (372928). --Cellular Sales Customer Service

name: Ginger H
text: We have a large family using eight different devices and various accessories. Everyone has different needs and habits. Michael V. has been a great help to all of us making sure each person has the right phone for their needs and their habits. We have quite a variety of personalities; dad doesn’t like change, some of us are accident prone, and others use their devices to manage all aspects of their lives. Michael has helped us on several occasions find the right fit for each person not only in devices but even in the accessories for each person. He is very knowledgeable about all the devices and the accessories. Personally, I am amazed at his patience with all the questions many of which I am sure we asked more than once. Thanks to Michael I feel we all get the most out of our devices and make the most of all the bells and whistles for each device. We all are very busy juggling life in general and we struggle to find the time to visit the store once let alone for every issue or family member. Trying schedule with time with each family member is difficult in the best of times, but this year it has been even more difficult with the need to be cautious because of the pandemic. Michael is always willing to work with us to find a way to schedule us in and has on occasion been very understanding about last minute changes. During those visits to the store, he made sure we felt comfortable with the procedures in place for preventing the spread of COVID. From helping us schedule a time to visit  inside with reduce numbers to being willing bring purchases to the car. On two occasions, I have had to call him from out of state to help deal with phone issues.  The first time, I was on the other side of the country when my husband who was at home reluctantly needed to replace his five-year-old phone. Michael handled the situation with his usually wonderful manner coaxing my husband into a new phone and making sure the transition as painless as possible for my husband (and me!!). The most recent of those was when we were all out of state and my daughter’s phone  broke and she was driving in a different vehicle and needed to have a phone. Fortunately, we found an old phone for her to use because we couldn’t wait for insurance replacement. Michael took the time to walk us through the steps and called to follow up and make sure my daughter had everything set up so she could have access to a phone. It gives me great piece of mind to know that each family member has access to the help they need from someone we trust and are able to stay connected even when I or they are out of state. Thanks to Michael I believe we are getting the best value for our money. It seems like every time I talk to him; I save money. I can’t find the words to express how grateful I am for the piece of mind I have. THANK YOU Michael in my book you are the best!!!

name: Amanda O
text: The staff at this location are amazing! My mom decided to upgrade her plan to unlimited data and they were so informative and helpful. Not only did they find a plan that worked for her family but they saved her money by changing her plan. She was so impressed she recommended their services to my father in law who was wondering if he should also alter his plan. The staff informed him that he didn't need to change his plan because it would be more than what he needs and would actually cost him more. How refreshing to have a sales person tell you the truth and actually choose NOT to sell you something because it's not in your best interest. Needless to say when it came time for me to order a new phone I chose this location and staff. They spent a lot of time explaining to me about each phone and what I needed. They also explained how to transfer everything from my old phone to my new phone and walked me through the entire process. Very knowledgeable, patient, kind, and helpful staff. Recommending to everyone!

text: I have been a Sprint costumer for over 12 years. And since I have moved to Alabama 9 years ago my service has been terrible. I finally made the decision to switch to Verizon. Alisha even kept me and my family laughing the whole time we were in the store. I have always dreaded getting a new phone. The process of remembering passwords, downloading apps, and set up of a new phone in general. However this has all been so EASY!!! I cracked my screen cover within the first couple of days and went back to the store to replace it. Molly was great with helping replace my cover. Even though I still think she sold me a wet wipe (I got the liquid glass screen protector). Lol inside joke. I just want to give a special thanks to these 2 girls and Verizon for making this change enjoyable! If you just need to laugh and smile go visit the staff at Verizon, great staff!!!

text: Went in to get a new phone on a referral from a friend. Had a nice selection, staff was helpful. Best experience ive had with a new phone

name: Joseph Wilson
text: My review starts off bad but ends GREAT. I went  in to the store and talked to Kara about a note 8 and a new plan. She was a great at helping me. I was told what my plan was going to be and agreed to it. Then when I was about to pay my bill, I realized that it was way higher than I was told. I called the 800 number and the person informed me that with the unlimited plan you can not use you're work discounts. I was very aggverted to hear that. I was misinformed. The guy on the phone could do very little to fix the problem. At that point I was going to turn in my phone because it seemed to me that Verizon doesn't care about it's customers. But a day later Kara from Cellular sales prattville called me and apologized for misleading me. At first I figured it was just the company's way to make me stay. But as we talked and she told me what she can do to fix this and the whole time she kept telling me she was sorry I could hear it in her voice. Her actions and her dedication to me the customer was outstanding. Because of her I am keeping Verizon and I am extremely happy with my phone. Thank you Kara. If you go to this store I recommend waiting for her to help you even if she has a line of people already. Truley the best customer service I have ever had.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Joseph .  We strive for a high level of service and are glad to hear that Kara met that level!  Thank you for being with Cellular Sales!  -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Joshua F
text: I went in to find out what was wrong with a newer verizon iphone 8 that is less than 6 months old: The store representative told our options: upgrade the phone using another line ($$$) or use insurance claim ($199 deductible). The rep gave us customer service phone number and an insurance pamplet and sent us on our way. Turns out the device was covered under a WARRANTY.....customer service is replacing the device free of charge unlike this location that provided poor service quality to a customer who has been with Verizon for over 10 years. We will not be back to this location as calling a phone number was more useful instead of getting suckered into upgrading a device that is less than 6mo old or using insurance for a manufacturer defect. They also were unwilling to assist with applying a discount on the account and again gave me the number for customer service. The employee we delt with was a waste of oxygen and a waste of salary on behalf of any reputable business. I recommend going up the road to the main verizon wireless store as this location was not able to provide even basic assistance besides trying to make you believe you have to give them more money.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Joshua. We can be reached at 877-851-0649 (Mon-Fri: 8am-8pm and Sat: 8am-6pm) or via email at Customerservice@cellularsales.com for further assistance. -- Cellular Sales Customer Service

Kara is a rockstar!

name: John Walker
text: About a month ago Kara (the tiny lady in the kid's clothes) was tasked with merging my freeloading old lady's account with my own. My initial impression: I'm sorry dear but can i speak to your manager (i.e. a man).... but it's 2018 so I gave her a chance... and I'm glad I did. Before i knew it she was guiding me through the process like Frodo led the Fellowship of the Ring. She was making calls, getting passwords and basically holding my hand through this entire process (don't tell my old lady, she won't appreciate the analogy.) She answered all of my questions and helped me save a bunch of money (which means more Bama stuff for me and the dogs! Roll tide!). Finally, she got corporate people one the phone and told me what to say to help me finish the transfer. When we were done our accounts merged like 2 souls coming together as one (that's a love making analogy). Thanks, Kara. I'll be sure to come to you if I ever need to upgrade to the new iphone X or Samsung S9.

name: Sam Ventocilla
text: I have done business with Ming previously and everything worked out extremely well. I ordered some tempered glass screen protectors from him and he even threw in some candy with it, to my surprise. He helped me solve an issue (my fault) I had with the screen protectors months after I purchased them. He knows how to fix many different devices and is willing to tackle the odd-ball repairs most other shops wouldn't touch. I definitely plan on doing business with him again!

name: Andrew Godfrey
text:
Brought my first phone in here. He repaired it in about 10 minutes. Asked him about the cases he was selling; giving him all opportunity to do some up selling. He said the nature of the damage would not have been affected with any case. Impressive. Seems upstanding establishment.

Son threw a friend in a pool and so we brought a second phone in. He said issues showed phone screen needed replacement and likely battery as well. After leaving phone with tech, he said replaced screen was in good shape, and that he didn't think i should pay for battery replacement. Wrote me a script for battery replacement at cost should we have any issues. Again, a wide opportunity to charge much more, yet he opted to be far more than fair.

I'll never take another phone anywhere other than Ming's. The level of service is simply insane.

Disclosure - I know nothing about "Ming".

name: George Sirmon
text: He helped us when none others could. He is honest, adept and responsible  and reasonably priced! Extremely pleased!

name: Alexis Lynch
text: Wonderful service & very nice. I was so excited about my phone finally getting fixed. It looked great when he got done. The only thing is when I made a call, I could hardly hear my call. And the volume was all the way up. I've never had any problems with my speaker until after my screen had gotten fixed. Calling tomorrow to see what can be done. I am still pleased with everything else. I highly recommend them & will be back with future phone issues.

resp.text:
Hey Alexis,

I'm very sorry that there is a problem with your repair. We feel that anything less than a 5 star rating means that we did not do our job to your 100% satisfaction.

Based on what you wrote about the ear speaker, it's possible that the plastic film is still left on the screen or a small plastic film on the ear speaker mesh is still on. Those are installed during manufacturing to prevent scratches and has to be removed for full functionality. Please check and make sure there isn't anything blocking the ear speaker itself, if so please remove it. If that is not the problem, please bring it by and we will take care of the problem for you. Don't worry, we will do everything in our power to make sure you are 100% satisfied with your visit.

Thank you very much,
Ming

text:
My screen looks great. However, I find it very odd that my iPhone has now been hacked into 4 days after this repair. I wouldn't think anything of it unless my ringtone hadn't been changed to a default tone when he handed it back to me...odd.
Working with Apple to find a solution and hopefully pin point who did. Other than that, ummm I like my screen protector.

resp.text: I'm very sorry for the late response we we don't check this at all. But we have never seen or heard of an iPhone getting hacked before. It's possible that you got a safari malware, which can be fixed by doing a clear history on your browser. We do not change customers ringtone during repair unless we have to check the speaker, in which we usually go to the ringtone in settings and play ringtone to avoid going through customers private files. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to resolve this issue and for you to change your rating of us. Thank you very much.

name: Bailey Booth
text: STAY AWAY! i had my screen replaced LG V20, the very day i brought it home it wouldnt fast charge anymore.....now it barely charges at all......takes 8 hours to charge. Was not doing this before i took it there

resp.text:
Hey Bailey I have tried contacting you but have not heard anything back,

I’m very sorry to hear that you are very unsatisfied with your repair. When you called a month ago, I explained to you that the charging port that controls the charging portion of the phone is part of the motherboard and not something that can be damaged during screen repair as we transfer over the whole motherboard. If it was damaged, it would not have been able to charge at all. I recommended trying a different charger to see if it was a charger issue and if not, bring it by and we would help take a look at it for you. When I didn’t hear back from you, I assumed the problem was resolved.

Charging issues like that are usually caused by charger going bad, broken solder joint on the charging port (caused by accidental bend of charger while plugged in), or sometimes if the battery is going out. So I think it is very unfair to us to give us such a bad review without giving us a chance to look at it and try to resolve the issue with you. Being a small local business, reviews like that can hurt us in a big way.

So if you can please give us a chance to properly diagnose your phone and resolve this issue, I would really really appreciate it. If you have any questions, you can reach me at our Store phone number (251)665-9888 during business hour.

Thank you very much and I hope to hear from you soon

name: Jason Willis
text:
Called about getting my phone fixed,Said they could do it no problem for $80.00. Drove 45 miles to their store was told it'd be $300.00 just for parts.  Found another place that fixed it for $85.00 in 45 minutes. I hate being lied to to get business.
Edit for reply:
My wife called Tuesday 1/5/21 and told whoever answered the phone, after telling them my issue (power button on my Samsung Galaxy S10 plus fell off). She was told that it wouldn't be a problem and no appointment needed that it'd be $79.00. As I mentioned before I live 45 miles away, I had to leave work early to make sure I had ample time to get there and to get service.
Yes, you are correct,  there was not a record or service ticket made because the guy there looked at my phone said that I'd have to leave it and that the parts would be $300.00 because the board would have to be changed out that the button was all one unit. I value my time and money as much as everyone else and I left without your service. Yes, I do feel like the initial phone call was a bait and switch just to get someone in the store. You know that $19.99 oil change costs $500 because you need tires,wipers, injector cleaning and "blinker fluid". It's just strange that my wife was told one thing and I was told another. I called another shop  told them exactly what was wrong, they said same thing. No problem, no appointment needed.  Took phone, they looked at it and the fixed it for the amount quoted.
Funny thing that one shop said one thing and the other one did it.

resp.text:
Jason, I cannot find a repair ticket or record of your name, are you sure you have the right place? If so, I would like to reach out to you to find out what happened, as we do not give bogus pricing to obtain business. Mistakes do happen and if this indeed did happen, I'd love the chance to make it right!

We have a proven track record of being transparent throughout our entire repair process and we pride ourselves on having some of the best pricing in the industry. I especially appreciate this review because it gives me a chance to explain our repair process.

Before I start, i'd like to point out one thing, there is a giant discrepancy between $80.00 and $300.00. The only phone parts that cost this much are some of the Genuine Samsung Display Assemblies. If another shop was able to resolve this for $85.00, it was a small part repair, like a charging port or proxy sensor, for example. (If parts were needed.) My point is, our prices would have been comparable.

When a customer calls in to obtain a price on a particular repair we do our best to go over the details of the problem or issue they are experiencing. If we are confident we know the solution to the issue at hand, we then will give you a price or at least a ballpark figure, so they know what to expect. If we are unsure what the solution is to the issue, we will ask you to bring the device in to be diagnosed, before giving you a price on the repair.

The Process.

1. Once you come into our office, we go over the details of the issue you are experiencing with your device. We will then go over repair solutions or inform you that it will need further diagnostics to obtain the solution to the issue.

2. We then obtain all your contact information and create you a ticket. We may at this time give you a price on the repair. Below are a couple normal situations.

*Lets go over a couple examples, an iPhone 8, the screen is damaged, everything else on the device is working as intended (we verify this,) we give you a price on the display assembly replacement and an ETA for expected completion.

*Now, lets say its a Gaming Computer, it is randomly turning off or blue screening. We will not know what the issue is without diagnosing all the hardware. In this situation, we will inform you that we will need to perform additional diagnostics to know what it will take to repair this device.

3. Once we have obtained the device, we then will start the diagnostics or repair in the order that it came in. We have other repairs in front of new repairs. Your device will go into the queue and will be worked on when its ticket is next. There are two exceptions to this. Most phone screen repairs, if we have the parts on hand (which we do for all iPhones and some Samsungs,) are completed in an hour or less. (Time will vary depending on the particular repair.) The other exception is, we offer a rush service, this service is paid at the time of when you drop off the device. This is paid to have the device worked on immediately, otherwise tickets are worked on in the order they are received.

4. Once the repair or diagnosis is completed, we then will email, text, and/or call you, to go over any final or further details.

5. Pick up your device and pay for the repairs. Once a repair is completed you can come by and pick up your device at your convenience. We also offer payment options, you can pay in person with cash or card, or you can pay your invoice through our online portal.

**One quick notes, due to COVID-19, we are not allowing our customers to wait on repairs in the lobby. They must either drop them off, wait in the their car, or outside of the building.

Jason, thank you for allowing us to go over this process with you and potential customers that may be reading this. Feel free to reach out to me, Clint Silver, owner at ProTek. I would love to know what happened and would love the opportunity to make it right. Thank you and as always, thanks for choosing ProTek!

name: Courtland Byrd
text:
I want to start by saying that after comparing tech repair companies I chose ProTek because of their great reviews. I debated leaving this review because I know how harmful bad reviews can be to a small business. Unfortunately, my experience with ProTek was so disappointing I felt obligated to share.
When replacing my screen ProTek compromised the integrity of my water resistant IPhone XS causing it to be hyper sensitive to moisture. This resulted in my phone being corroded by light water exposure only 3days after the iPhone repair. ProTek then refused to refund me the 200$ for the faulty screen replacement which essentially destroyed my 1000$ phone. Let me be clear that my IPhone had been exposed to water on previous occasions to the screen replacement with no issues. ProTek even assured me that there was no water damage prior to the screen replacement. I had expected to have a better experience with ProTek because I had confidence in their customer reviews. Sadly, I have to say I was dissatisfied with their services. At the very least I hope others will take my experience with ProTek into consideration and proceed with caution in regards to ProTek’s remarkable ineptitude with apple products.

resp.text:
I am very disappointed by this review, i'll explain why. Unfortunately for phones, we are in the warmer months and people like to be on the water and when you're on the water, these type of things will happen. I want to start off by saying that we repair and/or recover data from thousands of water damage devices. When you first brought the iPhone in for a screen replacement it was because you left the iPhone in the rain and it ruined the screen. (We informed the customer that the screen was the only thing damaged by the rain.) We replaced the screen and put a new screen seal on it, (as we do with all repairs.) The phone then came back with standing water inside the device, this amount of water is concurrent with other phones we see that have been submerged into water. The customer asked for a warranty on the screen, unfortunately we cannot warranty water or physical damage. (Simply putting a new screen on this iPhone would not resolve the issue, given the current condition.) In a case like this, with standing water inside the device, we would need to let the water dry (we have tools to speed this process up.) After the water has dried, it will leave corrosion behind, which will need to be cleaned. We would then remove the logic board from the iPhone housing, clean it with our Sonic Cleaner, and then test the device for further component damage. We then would replace the components needed to repair the device. More than likely we could have saved this customers phone, had the customer let us complete the water damage assessment on this device.

Please remember that iPhone's are not water proof, they are water resistant, and each iPhone has its own water resistance rating. We have seen water damage happen in pretty much every way, from being in your pocket and sweating, to being on the bathroom counter while taking a shower, and to drops in the ocean. Each iPhone handles each exposure differently, because in each exposure, the conditions are different. If you are going to be around water, buy a water proof bag, put your phone into the bag and use it from the outside the bag, only to remove it if you need to make a phone call. This will drastically minimize the chance of water damage. I hope this reply has answered any questions as to how we handle water damaged phones here at ProTek. If you have any questions, concerns, or just want some friendly advice, feel free to contact us at your convenience!

text:
My laptop stopped working, so I called ProTek and thankfully they were open. When initially speaking with the tech he advised me of the precautions that were being taken by the business to ensure safety during the COVID-19 pandemic for them and the customers.  This included the lobby and while working on my laptop.  When I entered the business, I noticed that they were taking all the CDC guidelines for COVID-19 very seriously and it made me feel more secure with the process.  The tech was very professional and knowledgeable.  The problem was diagnosed quickly and he carefully explained all the options I had to consider.  In the end, I decided to purchase a refurbished laptop from them and transfer the data. The price on the refurbished laptop was fair and I am glad to be back up and running. I would recommend them to anyone.
Thank you ProTek. 👍

resp.text: Thank you for the rating and review Mimi Shady Walnut! Glad to hear we have your recommendation!

name: gary robertson
text: They did what they said they would do and did it well.

resp.text: Appreciate the review Gary, glad to hear things went according to plan.

name: Shaun Glasgow
text: Great customer service.  Worked with me to provide an estimate on a laptop repair that had to be provided to the extended warranty company.  Repair completed in a timely manner and correctly.  Recommended.

name: John Justice
text: ProTek resurrected a dead Alienware laptop.  One new battery and solid state drive and it's up and running.  The restoration of services is proving relatively painless - it connected right up with my wireless and hooked up to the Internet with no problem.  Great job, guys.

resp.text: Thanks for the review John Justice, glad to hear we were able to to get you back up and running. Our goal is make repairs as easy and cost effective as possible.

resp.text: Denise we are sorry that you had such a bad experience with us. Upon bringing in your computer, you brought us two hard drives. We performed diagnostics on both hard drives and they both passed our diagnostics. Both hard drives where able to view and/or move files that where located on the drives. We installed the hard drives and installed your operating system as asked. We would like to offer you data recovery on your hard drive, this is complementary and will be at no charge. If you have any questions or need further support, please contact us @ 256-489-2904. Thanks!

resp.text: I am sorry that you had a less than perfect experience. Could you provide more detail? I cannot find any variation of your name in our system. Are you sure the device was serviced with us? Our goal is make sure that you as a customer, get a quality repair, at a fair price, and that you leave with a smile on your face. If we fell short of this, I will make it right. Please contact me, Clint Silver, the owner. Call me at the office anytime.

name: Carl Steele
text: I randomly googled "iPhone repair" and this was the top hit. It turned out to be the best option. I don't get many tech repairs, but this now my go to spot.

name: Matthew Durkovich
text: Top notch company - super fast results!  My M.2 SSD work hard drive crashed, and after my own IT dep't couldn't fix it, I took it in and it was ALL recovered!  Losing data is very stressful, and these guys were very good at explaining everything.  They returned my call promptly, reminded me that they close at 7pm and were not trying to rush me into seeing them the next day, and offered to assess my hard drive w/out charging me.  In about 5 minutes he came back and said it was all there, and then explained the difference between the $150 cost, and the $300 cost.  basically if I wanted 40GB of files in one folder, it was $150.  if I wanted it to look like it did (folder structure) before the crash, it woudl take more time and therefore $300.  Best extra $150 I have ever spent!  They found info from several previous users, which I'm sure my IT dep't will be thrilled with, lol.  They were great to communicate with, no suprises, met all my expectations, and delivered.  I will go back to them ANY time I need something recovered (or break my phone - didn't even know they fixed phones).  Thanks ProTek!

name: Gerald Marotta
text: These guys replaced cracked screens on my wife's Samsung smartphone and on my 8" tablet.  Both not "the usual" screen replacements.  On the tablet, they tracked down the glass replacement and ordered it from China.  No other local technicians would go through that much trouble.

name: Scott Dickinson
text:
Ever get that sick feeling in your stomach when you've messed something up? That was me. I had taken apart my laptop because of excessive dust on the fan and the put it back together incorrectly. Seeing an ad for a national company in Huntsville that did computer repair I took it there. 3 weeks later and I get a call that says they can't fix it locally and need to send it off, $75 please.

Discouraged, I collect my laptop and buy a new one. But then I realize I need documents that were stored locally on the old laptop. So searching the internet, I find ProTek. I call and they tell me they can recover my  data.

So I bring my old laptop and then they say, hey, can we try and fix it? Sure, I say. One week later, they've fixed my laptop, and it's up and running for less then what I paid for a new laptop!

Fantastic work! So before you take it to a national place, give the local guys at ProTek a chance to fix your laptop! You won't regret it !

Everything was perfect before they got  it. Just a quick update, The same day i posted this Clint called me and was very eager to repair the laptop. name: Stan Goodley
text: AT&T  3 days ago (Saturday) I moved a few miles down the road to an apartment complex that is wired exclusively for one internet provider, @AT&T. Prior to moving I was told by a AT&T customer service that since the building is already wired for AT&T, all I needed to do was take my router with me and plug it in at my new apartment. I double checked, “are you sure?”, to which I was again assured that it was just that simple. Several days later I move and plug the router in. No internet. I call AT&T and tell them what happened, and they scheduled a technician to come to my apartment several days later (Tuesday) to activate my service. It’s Tuesday night now, so I call and ask when I can expect to see the tech. After a long process of being put on hold and transferred to a “manager”, I’m told that I didn’t actually have an appointment. Even worse, they told me that it would be THREE WEEKS until they’d be able to get someone out to my apartment. I live in downtown Birmingham, a relatively big city, and they don’t have a single tech that can spend 20 minutes activating my internet service. Are you kidding me AT&T? What if I worked from home, or if I had a kid who was learning remotely? What if I caught covid and couldn’t leave for 2 weeks but still had to work? I literally have no other options besides using AT&T and they know this. I was misled multiple times by their representatives, then told to wait for nearly a month for a service I ALREADY PAY FOR. I’ve never posted any sort of product or service complaint, but this is the worst experience I’ve had as a customer. I really hope people see this and think twice before they switch to AT&T. Don’t do it!

resp.text: Hello Matt H. We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates. If it is convenient for you, we have staff at our retail locations that might be able to assist you with your issue.

text:
Had a surprisingly great experience, compared to a recent encounter with my current carier, when I went in to check out the Galaxy S10+ to see if it felt right . The store representative, Bailey, was extremely helpful and made what was just a quick look into a great discussion about what I need in this phone and a very pleasant experience. His knowledge on the Galaxy phones was extensive and I was able to come to a decision quickly during our talk. I work in tech and didn’t feel like I was trying to be sold to or have someone try and get me to buy something lease, but felt like I was talking to a peer about these new phones.

While I was there, he was also able to check and see if AT&T Fiber was available in my neighborhood yet (it wasn’t) and talked me through how to know when that would occur.

Overall, AT&T keeps impressing me with each encounter I have with their customer service reps and if every rep was as knowledgeable and pleasant as Bailey, they would no doubt be rated the top in customer service. Once I they have Fiber available, I’m switching back over.

name: Kayla Smith
text:
The most unprofessional manager I've ever seen or had to the deal with. She's not only rude to the customers, but she cant keep her nose out of her phone long enough to make eye contact. The numerous times I've been in there along with  my colleagues, I've never actually seen her do a repair let along do actual work. Not to mention repairs she has done she has messed up. What kind of manager doesn't know how to do her job and do it well. I refuse to walk in this store for business and will take my devices else where as long as she's working and if the Tech guy isn't there. She seems very withdrawn from her work, an lacks motivation skills! Also very hard to take someone serious working on my devices with a big piece of metal sticking out of their lip.

Now as for the ACTUAL TECHS, I've had nothing but great customer service, devices done an ready when they are said to be ready. And always courteous and professional. Very helpful when it comes to explaining what's wrong with the devices. For someone who has done several reviews for several stores on their performances and what they can do to fix it to welcome more business, The manager needs to get some Professional act right, this is a Booming business all over the country not many people can handle this kind of work and all it takes is ONE person to make it to be a bad place of business.

resp.text:
Hello Kayla I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Kayla. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.
iFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (334) 357-6349

name: Jessica Miller
text: Terrible. That about sums it up. Paid $100 to fix the screen but what’s so great about a fixed screen if the camera on neither side works, the light doesn’t work, and you can’t hear anything if someone calls? Not a thing. But to make matters worse you take it back for them to fix their mess up but wait, they tell you it’s not their fault it’s a censor and you can give them $60 more and they’ll fix it. I think not. It was working when I brought it in and when I walked out it wasn’t. So if you want more problems than you currently have then sure I’d recommend you take your electronics here.

This is not by any means reflective the #iFixandrepair standards of service and customer satisfaction.

name: Travis Porter
text:
Took my iPhone 6 Plus to have the screen replaced due to a very small crack. The associate working said no problem would take about 20 minutes. After 1 1/2 hours later the associate informs me he thinks he shorted out my back light and that my phone would have to be sent off for repair. I am somewhat of an understanding person until he informed me it would take weeks for me to get my phone back. I am a professional in my field of work and 100% rely on my phone to make a living. I was told sorry and that sending it off was the only option for me.. PLEASE BEWARE & DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE GOING TO THESE GUYS FOR WORK. Guess I should have done my homework and read the reviews on facebook first.

Please see above and notice I said nothing about a payment! Today is now Thursday and I am still without a phone! I will also be sure to leave my review with them as well seeing my bad customer service experience has extended to your location as well as your corporate office.

name: Duncan Mills
text:
I’m calling you out IFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (NOT the Dothan Walmart Location). In particular, the manager at this location.

I work for a phone carrier in the same mall and I had a customer approach my stand, asking if the “Apple Airpods” you just sold her were really a legit Apple product. From a few feet away, they looked legit, but upon further inspection, they were definitely a counterfeit. I sell plenty of Apple products out of my store on a daily basis and have for 5+ years. I can tell just by the fit/finish, packaging, font, etc that these are definitely not a real Apple product, or even a refurbished unit.

From what your customer told me, you reassured her that they were a legitimate product, and refused to offer her a refund, only store credit until she threatened to get mall management and the police involved.

Shame on you for preying on elderly and unknowing customers trying to get Christmas gifts for their families. She told me she spent the last $90 of her fixed income to get these for her daughter as a late Christmas gift.

You are selling items under false pretenses and not disclosing the authenticity of the products. Makes me wonder how many other people you have ripped off with this same scam. This is some shady business practices and unfortunately it can tarnish the customer’s trust in cellular/mobile vendors and repair companies alike.

Pictured is the “Apple AirPods” you sold her and the last picture is a stock image of the legitimate product from Google from a trusted device review source.

name: Ryan Cunningham (rjcfilms)
text: Had a broken tablet took it to I fix in the mall and they said they would order the part and it would be a same day repair when it came in. A week or so passed and they called and said the part was in. I took my tablet in for repair they said they may not get to it that day because they were busy... understandable. Well I came back late the next day and they said they still haven't got to it and they would leave a note to do it first thing the next day. Well the next afternoon I called and they still didn't have it ready. So a few more days passed and they called and said they had broken the screen and had to order a whole new screen. Told us we had to wait for the tech to get paid because he had to pay for the new replacement parts. It took more than 1 month to get the new parts and for them to finally call us and say it's ready. We get to the store and ask to pick up the tablet and it is in horrible condition the back panel wasn't even put back on properly and had spots where it was raised up enough I could see the internals on the tablet. We refused to take it that time because it was not repaired. We also learned the the money we origanally paid them to fix it was refunded to the tech who had broken the tablet. The employee/tech refused to try to repair the tablet saying "I'm not going to try to press that together and break that tablet." She was referring the the back panel I mentioned was raised up in places. We told her to contact the manager and she pulled out her cell phone called the manager and said "These people are refusing to take the tablet and I'm so mad I'm about to just walk out" the manager told her to tell us she would take a look at it tomorrow. A few days passed they called again and said it was ready so we went to get it and it was better condition but still it is very scuffed up on the trim all the way around the screen and the back is still slightly raised up in a few places. We took it anyway out of pure frustration with the employees and the manager. This place is a joke DO NOT take anything here to be fixed or you will regret it. This is the first time I've ever written a review but this place was so bad I felt like I needed to put it out there that this place is not a professional establishment and they treat their customers like garbage after you hand them your money.

resp.text:
Hello Ryan  I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Ryan. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations.
Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.
iFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (334) 357-6349

name: Stephen Smith
text: I would strongly recommend against allowing anyone at this location to attempt to repair your property.  I took in my iphone 5s for a cracked screen.  Up front they were very confident stating that it would only take about 45 mins and for a somewhat reasonable price.  The first screen they put on they said was "glitchy".  The second screen had screws that were so over-tightened they pushed through to the glass.  The third screen worked but somewhere along the way several other items were damaged.  When first checking in the phone they did a thorough checklist noting that everything worked properly.  Now I have a phone that doesn't have a vibrate function anymore, the earpiece only works sometimes, and it drops calls all of a sudden now.  They told me that they aren't sure what is wrong and they will order a part and maybe that will work.  I told them I didn't want anyone else trying to work on my phone anymore (3 different people already messed up different parts of the phone).  I asked for a refund and was told that if they got approval from the district manager, they might be able to install a broken screen  on my phone and give me my money back.  Do yourself a favor and read the reviews on Yelp, and the BBB.  This business has shown that they will damage your property and keep your money.

resp.text:
Hello Stephen I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Stephen. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Eric Faulx
text:
***EDIT***

***Ms. Casey had everything fixed for me once this post was made, 4 starring it for everything that happened. Would recommend to friends, and will go back if I ever need quality work.***

They charged me $120+tax to repair my broken screen and BREAK MY HOME SCREEN BUTTON! Two days ago I took my iPod 5 in to get the screen replaced on it. The home button still worked on it prior to me dropping it off. Once I got my iPod Touch back with the screen repaired my home button no longer worked. Casey, the owner, claimed it to be a result of the damage that occurred to it prior and I had come to found out that it actually was a result of her improperly removing the button. She tore the conductive ribbon strip from the home button that lets it depress and click the dome switch underneath. She claimed that it was not her fault did not offer any kind of apology and told me it was unfixable. I have also been told this kind of repair is not fixable by any conventional means and that the iPod might as well be replaced. DO NOT GET YOUR DEVICES "REPAIRED" AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT. Extremely dissatisfied with this business and it's practice -Eric Faulx

resp.text:
Good afternoon Eric,

Sorry to hear that. We are reviewing your case with our DM. In short we will give you a quick answer.

name: James Jones
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR PHONE HERE! Awful experience from a person that claims to be a manager! The individual clearly had no idea how to repair the phone and would not admit it prior to damaging the phone beyond repair. First the "manager who has so much experience" proceeds to pry the back of the custom bamboo backing on my wife's phone warping it where it will not lay flat. Then when doesn't know how to take the last screw out and breaks the ribbon cable that powers the phone. While she did offer to order the part that she broke she did not disclose that she had already damaged the back of the phone and then when confront just casually says well I have to get it off and it is just a piece of plastic. It was fine when it left here. Clearly there was no real concern for damaging someone else's property when she order a $12.00 part "out of her own pocket" and act like that makes up for damaging the phone without recourse
