name: Donna Mott
text:
I would not recommend this store to dust off the screen of a phone or tablet much less attempt to repair it.  If I could give less than 1 star, I would.  We took an iPad 3 to iFix on December 20th to have a broken screen replaced.  We called later that evening and went to pick it up after they said it was complete.  We tested the iPad while at the store in front of Tyler, an iFix employee, and the power button wouldn't work, the magnetic closure to put the iPad to sleep wouldn't work, and you couldn't lock/unlock the iPad.  They also scratched the body of the iPad around the edges when they replaced the screen.  Tyler made a note of the issues and agreed we could bring the iPad back for repair after the Christmas holiday.  While we had it, the screen detached from the iPad body.

We took it back to iFix on or about January 9th.  We had to swipe (erase all content) off the iPad for them to repair it, so we had to buy a new one to replace this one in the interim.  We have received NO communication from anyone with iFix since that time unless we've called for a status.  We have called numerous times to speak with the manager, David and Tyler the original employee dealing with us on this.  Each time it's the same story...they're working on it and since that time, David is no longer with them.  I emailed all of the contacts on the Corporate iFix website and never received a response.  The employee we were dealing with, Tyler, can't tell us anything and he said the district manager was now handling our case.

Amber Wells, the District Manager with iFix, and they would not agree to refund the $196.19 we paid for the screen replacement and she said they can't repair it.  I filed a Better Business Bureau complaint in March and iFix never responded to it.  The leasing manager, Rhonda Clark, at Wiregrass Commons Mall has attempted to get this resolved with the owner but has not been successful.  Apparently there are other customers who have complained to the mall management because iFix won't stand behind their work, lack of work, or whatever you wish to call their shoddy attempt at service.

At the very minimum, they should have refunded what I paid for the repair.  Unfortunately now, I have no confidence that the iPad will ever work the same even if someone else replaces the screen.  PLEASE don't make the mistake of taking any devices to this store.

As of September 24, 2014 they STILL have my iPad.  Nearly 9 months later and nothing from them...no attempt at resolution at all.  iFixandrepair has yet to contact me.  Apparently they have no interest in resolving the issue.  I'm taking them to small claims court to try to get this resolved.  Again, I would NOT recommend them for repairs of any sort based on my personal experience and the lack of concern of their staff.

resp.text:
Hello Donna I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Donna. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.
iFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (334) 357-6349

name: mrryanrytyclark
text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. I have never had a worse experience at a retail store than I did last week. We were completely mislead about a promotion that was going on, went forward with a purchase and then they reneged on part of the promotion 6 days after. A total lack of transparency and complete misrepresentation of the promotion and sale. The manager was rude and condescending when I spoke to him after the fact, it was made out like it was all my fault and that the sales person simply "mispoke". When I preceded to ask for a Regional or District Manager to talk to about my experience he would not give any info to me. We have been customers with Verizon for over 15 years and have bought multiple phones at this location since it opened a few years ago, and am at a total disbelief that they would let a valued and loyal client be treated that way. I will never visit this location again and advise people not to. I am not the type of person to leave reviews and complain but I want to warn other consumers to not fall for the fake and misrepresented "promotions" that are not true.

text: Mark was great! Very patient and knowledgeable. He let me know about a great deal on an upgrade that I took advantage of. They will be my go to place for Verizon. Thank you, Mark!

name: Matthew McAnally
text:
There's a corporately owned store in Jones Valley FYI

Ask for Devon. If he's still employed there, leave.

October 31st - Went into the store to trade in two iPhone SE 2020's(currently being paid for with installments) for 2 iPhone 12's(one pro one not). The rep, Devon, was dipping the entire time he helped us. It took longer because he was describing how he had lost another customer's money by entering wrong info into their system, and was making sure he didn't do the same with us. It was busy, so I decided to wait him out. We were offered two options for upgrading the devices:

1 - Pay of the SE 2020's in full for $720-ish and trade them in for a $440 promotional value applied over 24 months towards the new phones.

2 - Trade in the 2020's towards their own outstanding balance, making the payoff balance ~$360, then starting the iPhone 12's fresh.
I opted for door # 2 as it would be only $160 more over the 2 years, but would be $360 less today.

Nov 1st - Devon disagreed I guess and called me letting me know that it wasn't his fault, but I would have to go pay another $360 to his store, BUT IT'S OKAY I'M GETTING THE PROMOTION I DIDN'T ASK FOR. He really stressed, many times, that it wasn't his fault.

I let him know that it wasn't going to fly, and he said he was going to call his boss and call me back in five minutes.

Eight hours later, I get a text from Devon: Verbatim "Hey man I just got a response from my higher up. You can't put it on your bill you will have to go back to the store and pay it"

I asked for said higher up to give me a call. I guess his definition of "higher up" is his customer service trainer. Said trainer started the call with a "here we go" long sigh and then told me that they know he's a problem, it was his fault, and I still have to pay $360. I ask what time they open the next day and he tells me they open at 9. They open at 10. I then ask if there is someone competent that will be there. He says someone competent will be there at 10:30. Seems kind of insulting to whoever was there before 10:30.

Nov 2nd - The competent employee was indeed competent though. It took 30 minutes of sitting in front of the counter at the store while the competent employee talked to exactly one person and had it fixed. It was painless enough to bring a star back to what is honestly a 0 star experience.

Devon called me a few minutes after I left the store to let me know that he had fixed the problem. I let him know that, no he didn't, competent employee did. He then began stressing that he was calling to let me know so I wouldn't have to go up to the store. As if his good intentions would make up for the error, the lack of effort to fix it, the attempt to put me in contact with people who wouldn't get him in trouble, and finally lying to me trying to take undue credit for fixing a problem that he created.

They then offered me a discount on a phone case or accessory for my troubles. They were out of what I wanted.

name: e t
text:
NOT a VERIZON Corporate Store.  BEWARE!!!!

So first of all, this is not a real Verizon store.  It is the same thing as going to a kiosk in a mall to get a phone or change a phone plan.  You won't see this tidbit of information anywhere unless you really look or ask specifically.

The employees work on commissions and therefore don't have your best interest in mind.  They will peddle the phones and plans with the best kickbacks (go in and ask about an iPhone and see what they say about it; most assuredly they will try to discourage those phones as the commissions are much lower than Samsung/LG etc.)

The employees also do not put out the correct information.  They twist the truth to try to sell and change your plans.  They updated my account to the Verizon Unlimited data plan from the 16GB plan and when we specifically asked if there would be a speed or service difference, we were told no; it's identical.  OOPS!!  After numerous dropouts and super slow data service, when when on 4G, we called Verizon and was told that the plan we're on is the first to be 'booted' off a tower or throttled due to bandwidth issues.  Fortunately Verizon (the real Verizon) was able to fix our account and put us back to the plan we had where we will get good service again.

Lesson learned here.  We will NEVER again go to a non-Verizon store (except Costco, their reps are pretty good) and certainly will not set foot in this store again.  The number of untruths and misleading info makes me regret patronizing this place.

name: Trrish Tee
text: I went in to get info on the Att products and ended up switching from T-Mobile and upgrading to the iPhone 12 on the notion that I would only pay 8$ a month for the new phone and 700$ credit for the trade in. Well to my surprise they are trying to charge me 32$ a month for the phone and a 100$ for the service. I also signed up for att-tv and it was nothing as described so I switch to direct tv. The installer got to my house and said they don’t run wires and I had to get wireless boxes for a 100$ one time fee. When asked what they do for customers that never had direct tv we only run wires underground, because my house was already wired from the previous owners he said I would have to pay someone outside of direct tv to run the wires and after I do that call direct tv to have someone else come back out set up my wired service.  When I call customer service I can’t get a straight answer. I just want my IPhone 11 back if I can’t get what was promised and cut all ties with Att.

name: J Fleming
text: The last few times myself or my family have been to an ATT store it has been far from a pleasurable experience. The atmosphere has become that of a used car lot . The sales Reps work off commission  ,and as soon as they see you are not switching to Direc tv, or whatever else they are selling, they shut down and don’t want to help you. Because of this I have been going to the Apple store to purchase my devices. A few days ago I went into this ATT store to get a new I phone because I needed it ASAP.  I went in to strictly buy an iPhone and nothing else . After declining all the other sales pitches, I pay the sales tax get my receipt and go on my way . The next day I got an email showing the changes to my plan . The sales rep decided she was going to enroll me in the next plan and add insurance to my phone . I didn’t ask for or authorize any of that . She did not mention she was doing it either . This kind of behavior is far past unethical. So the next days I have spent much of my valuable time  calling corporate straightening this out . I have been an Att customer for over 20 years . I no longer have any trust in them .   Buyer beware!!!!!!

resp.text: Hello J. Your experience in our store matters to us. We work hard to staff our stores with knowledgeable and friendly associates, and this is not the experience we wanted you to have. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Our goal is to provide a better experience in the future.

text:
Tyler was awesome!!! He helped with all our needs and answered all our questions. I would recommend him to anyone that needs a new phone or having any problems with their service.

***************UPDATE**************
After I received my bill, AT&T charged me for an additional line that I did not add. I’ve been to the store twice and have called customer service several times with both saying the other has to remove the line. Customer Service would not let me speak to a supervisor, he took my number and said a supervisor would call me. NO return call! I ask the store to call customer service while I was there and was basically told no they would not do that. I’m going back in the morning again after customer service said again the store needs to correct but if it’s not resolved I’ll be changing to another carrier (after more than 10 years at AT&T). name: Ashley Johnigan
text:
Excellent Experience. Safety insured during Pandemic

Update: I received my first bill after I bought my iPhone and also an iPad. I was charged for two iPads on my bill and nothing was done about it. The manager could not be found and no one knew exactly when he would be in the store. I had to pay a restock fee of $55.00 after being told that there was no way anyone else in the store could give credit back on the additional iPad that was charged to my account.

Initially  the customer service representative told me that my bill would only increase by $5.00. However, I was charged $60.00 for the iPad on the first bill and $24.97 for another iPad I didn’t even buy!! I had to call 611 in order to get a credit on my bill for the amount that I was lied to about. Also, the customer service representative that sold me the iPad was there and did not take the initiative to apologize for the lack of explanation of the bill. There was insurance placed on the iPad without my knowing. I didn’t notice until I looked at the bottom of the receipt and bill on today!  I will never visit this AT&T again. Also, not being able to get in touch with a manager when needed is awful. Especially if the manager is scheduled to be at work and is the only that can take care of certain issues!!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Ashley, thank you for stopping by the South Tuscaloosa retail store on today, like always we value your loyalty with the company as our customer and hope to see you again soon!

name: Julia D
text: I am not an ATT customer,  but my father is. My father has been diagnosed with dementia.  Anyway, he went in to get a new flip phone and was told that ATT does not make them anymore. They then sold him a Touch screen phone and he didn't know how to answer or make a call.  I then went online and ordered an ATT flip phone because they do still manufacture them. Dad tried to return the phone a couple days later but came back with the phone. Since I know that his mind works differently now I told him we would go back the following Monday, which we did.  My dad was a little upset feeling like he was lied to when we got there----that did not help for sure. The ATT employee was immediately defensive and disrespectful.  I felt sorry for the young man because I know he'll never get anywhere in life like that. I then decided to speak for my dad and push him out of the way to calm his attitude,  but the employee seemed spiteful and maintained his little smirk. Totally not helpful. There was a level headed employee who came over and explained the phone price vs restock fee.  We ended up keeping the phone due to restocking fee. My advice to ATT is dont forget that Americans still value customer service and a smile. Those two ingredients can bring light into any retail situation. I'll never spend money on bad customer service.

resp.text: Hi Julia D. Our number one goal is to provide you with an exceptional customer experience. We sincerely appreciate you and all our customers and look forward to providing you a better experience in the future.

name: Gregory Eagerton
text: Was not able to complete the process of setting up in-store appointment online so called store and got prompt response to call by Randall.  He immediately set up appointment for later that day so that we could review plans and upgrade phones.  He was waiting at door to greet us at the appointment time; he was the ultimate professional and walked us through the process identifying how we could have better service at a more cost efficient price.  He then reviewed each phone that we were interested in and matched our needs with the right phone.  He never once attempted to "over-sell" us which has never been our experience in the past when purchasing phone equipment.  He then reviewed upgrade discount offers and walked through the data transfer process from old phone to new.  We were in and out in about 45 minutes which is an all time record.  Randall was the most professional, personable, and honest phone services representative we have ever worked with and it made a huge difference in my perception of how this was going to be.  The store was well prepared to practice safe social distancing and managing customers so that we felt completely "COVID safe".  Highly recommend the store and certainly, if you have the option of customer representatives, work with Randall!

resp.text: Thank you, Gregory , for taking the time to share your review. We are always happy to hear when our customers have a positive experience. Thank you for being a Cellular Sales Customer! -- Cellular Sales Customer Service 1-877-851-0649

name: Rob McDonald
text: My Jetpack hotspot was never very good, and finally just stopped taking a charge when the battery swelled. There was a recall (I was not notified, but saw a sign when I arrived), but the rep said I'd have to jump through a bunch of hoops and be without my hotspot to have it handled under the recall. As I use my hotspot for work every day, that wouldn't work. So my only remaining option was to upgrade to a better unit and pay over $150 for that, which I had to do. The new unit seems to work better, but I didn't appreciate being forced to pay more to replace a recalled product or wait for some undetermined amount of time without use of my hotspot. I don't know whether this was a store policy or Verizon's, but it isn't great customer service either way.

resp.text: Thank you for making us aware of your experience, Rob. If you have any further questions or concerns, please contact our team at 877-851-0649 or customerservice@cellularsales.com. -- Cellular Sales Customer Service

text: These folks were super helpful! The wait time was not non-existent but no longer than normal. That said, I never felt like they forgot about me while I was sitting there waiting. Instead, they worked really hard to try to fix my phone and then when that didn't work they determined it was a manufacturer's defect and replaced it at no cost. They never tried to nickle-and-dime me at all. I don't love going to to verizon but this was easily the best experience I've had at a verizon store.

text: If you want great customer service come to this store. The employees are always very friendly and helpful! I saw Allison this past Wednesday to upgrade my phone. She was able to help lower my bill and get me into a new phone! I live in Sumiton but will come to this store now on.

name: Jay Hines
text: I've upgraded or purchased new Verizon phones from several different locations and I will never go to a different one after my most recent trip to the Vestavia location. The staff was exceedingly helpful and made me feel like they had my best interest at heart. This was a refreshing change of pace from most retail experiences where I feel like I'm being over sold on things I don't want or need. The staff was very professional and listened to what my needs were and got creative to not only meet those needs but also save money on my bill in the process. Lastly, and perhaps most importantly, I was in and out of there in a matter of minutes. I expected this process to take an hour at least. I was out of there in 15 minutes with all expectations met (i.e. contacts, pics, apps and videos transferred).

name: Taylor Rollins
text: I went into the AT&T store in Scottsboro, AL to get an iPhone. I only had so much money to work with, and was greeted and serviced immediately. My credit isn’t great, and I’m only 21, but the guy in there was able to set me up with the iPhone I originally wanted for a low down payment, cheap monthly payments, and an inexpensive plan! I didn’t get any details about the contract he chose for me, nor was I asked to choose. I also had to ask how much total my bill would be a month, and was not told how/where I could pay, but I love it!!

name: Dylastion Tuten
text: I went into att in scottsboro for them to set me up on a prepaid account. They asked for my social security number to make sure that I didn’t owe att any money. As the man employee was getting me set up the manager came and took over the entire project. As I was sitting there the manager kept asking me if I owned a business and a bunch of other questions. I answered not knowing that they were signing me up for a business account. Through the entire time I was in there the manager never once told me what he was doing. While I was sitting there he started bragging about setting up drug dealers on business accounts as pharmaceutical companies. And how he has done it many times. So a couple weeks pass and I get a bill in the mail for $126 when the manager told me it would only be $65 plus tax. So I called the store to figure out what happened and the manager called me a liar. So I decided to go to the store the next off day I had. Well today I went to the store and the manager refused to deal with me because I refused to wear a mask for medical reasons. Then after me telling him about the medical issues he still made me wear a mask. And didn’t help in anyway to fix any of the problems I had and called me a liar. And he refused to tell me how to get in touch with anyone over him.  And for everyone wanting to do business with this store please wait until they have someone in management that is honest enough to tell you exactly what they are doing with your personal information. If I could give zero stars I would and hopefully they will get someone competent enough to do business the right and legal way!!! Hopefully someone will see this and get this problem taken care of!!!

resp.text: Hi Dylastion! Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We understand how frustrating this might be, and we apologize for any inconvenience. We'll get with the staff to ensure they are reviewing current promotions correctly with every customer. Thank you!

text: I have been in and out of this retail location off and on now for several months. The New Manager is phenominal. She goes out of her way to answer everyone's questions. Most locations simply just sell you something and forget your name. The staff at this location not only remember my name, but remember my needs and always keep me up to date with current promotions. In fact this store actually called me back just to let me know a rate plan changed and saved me even more money on my monthly bill. I have cut my Verizon bill almost in half thanks to the sales associates at this location. I would not recommend any other place to meet my or my families wireless needs.. I hope you find this review helpful, I tried to be honest.
